programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nikki Chapman returns one year on to discover whether the Haroon family moved to Australia after spending a trial week in Perth. Harry Haroon dreamed of joining the country's police force, but his wife Nabeela was reluctant to leave their family in the UK

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a former office block in Folkestone, Kent, which has been converted into flats, a three-bedroom semi-detached home in Willaston, Cheshire, and a mid-terraced property in Edmonton, London. After three months the team returns to review their progress

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Lawrence and Kev go to a London guitar store to recover money on behalf of a client, while sheriffs Pete and Dave deal with the case of a parking officer who was dismissed from his job and denied the payment he was entitled to

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright looks at the cases of Peter Nicholson, Newham Council's former head of the Youth Offending Team, who received an OBE but was later jailed for stealing money, and a veterinary nurse who feared having to give up work to stay with her young daughter when she showed signs of developmental delay

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and Thomas Plant join two teams to compete at an antiques fair on Wetherby Racecourse, West Yorkshire, before selling their purchases at auction. Plus, presenter Tim Wonnacott learns about 18th-century hellraiser James Pennyman during a visit to Ormesby Hall, near Middlesbrough

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karen is fascinated by a glamorous socialite who arrives in Letherbridge with a hidden agenda. Heston is left to face an emotional Valerie, while Fliss returns to see Al and has a serious request. Medical drama, starring Jan Pearson and Owen Brenman

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Jack gets nearer to finding the other missing boy, and the hunt for Eddie's attacker compromises Pratt's relationship with his son. Meanwhile, there is another rape, but this time the consequences are deadly, and Gina and Jack become closer following some trouble at home

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple on the cusp of retirement search for their perfect rural retreat in Herefordshire, with a budget of Â£400,000. The presenter also takes time out from the property search to visit a farm that produces a special blackcurrant liqueur

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Antiques experts Eric Knowles and Catherine Southon cross the Channel to go head-to-head at the St Ouen flea market in Paris. They have a budget of Â£750 to spend on their goods before they return to the UK in the hope of selling them for as much profit as possible

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bianca is less than happy when Terry, feeling guilty after his treatment of Nikki, lets her stay for dinner before she leaves for Acapulco - and his ex soon shows her true colours when she offers David a proposition that would change his world. Will he accept? A drunken Masood turns up at Carol's, upset to discover she has cancer and angry she didn't think he could look after her, while Linda is excited at the thought of Johnny and Whitney getting together - horrifying her son when he realises his mum has not come to terms with his sexuality

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the fortunes of family-run retail business Poundworld and its CEO Chris Edwards, as he battles his high-street competition. The company's biggest rival, Poundland, reduces all its prices by 3p in East Ham, so Chris retaliates by launching what he thinks is a surefire winner - the Â£1 bra. But will it really attract more shoppers? The boss also thinks he needs to cut back on staff to raise revenue to fund new shops, so he sends his cost-cutting expert back to the shop floor to see whether his plans would damage customer service

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: New series. It's 1969 and six months since the shootings in Durham Cathedral, and while Gently is almost back to full fitness, Bacchus has lost his confidence and tenders his resignation. Gently is determined to help his sergeant, so he gets him involved in one last case, the death in custody of a man arrested during a street protest - an investigation that leaves both detectives questioning what it means to be a police officer at a time when attitudes to the force are changing. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Lisa McGrillis, Steve Evets and Ruth Gemmell

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Gillingham in Kent, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include former Labour cabinet minister Tessa Jowell and Respect MP George Galloway

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and Alan Johnson take a light-hearted romp through the political and parliamentary developments of the past seven days. They will be discussing who is making the headlines and the issues that matter to both MPs and the public

programme.title: Skiing Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with the Andrews family, who disagreed about moving to Perth in Western Australia. While Melanie wanted a new life overseas, husband Rob struggled with the thought of leaving his relatives behind. During a trial week Down Under, Rob's work prospects looked good and it seemed his wife's dream might be within reach. Two years on, they reveal whether they took the plunge and moved for good

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a two-bedroom house in Staffordshire, a flat in London and a property in Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, all of which were bought at auction

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The enforcement officers try to help a pharmacist who did not get paid for 12 weeks and are given the cold shoulder when they chase up a debt in Derbyshire. They also go back on the trail of a builder who received Â£4,000 from an 86-year-old woman for shoddy work on her roof

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Following a tip-off about forged French passports, Ealing Council uncovers a hidden stash of false identities, forged documents and Â£215,000 worth of fraudulent benefit claims. Matt Allwright also meets a woman who had to give up work to look after her 11-year-old grandson after the death of her daughter, but with money tight she is struggling to support him

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams head to the Norfolk showground to unearth three treasures in an hour with Â£300. On hand to lend their expertise are Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant, while Tim Wonnacott uncovers an oriental oddity

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Howard unexpectedly finds himself working with Barry Biglow to apprehend a Russian sleeper agent at large on the university campus. Meanwhile, Al supports Fliss, and Jimmi and Hermione find that being too similar has its downside

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Gina's life is placed in danger when an attempt to lure the killer into a trap takes a deadly turn, while Jack makes a horrifying discovery about the criminal that could prove vital to his colleague's survival. Crime drama, starring Jennie Jacques and Kieran Bew. A new series begins on Monday

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton heads to Yorkshire to help a keen baker and his business-focused wife find a rural retreat on a budget of Â£350,000. The presenter scales the heights of York Minster and gets a preview of the restoration work being done to the building's stained-glass windows

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Eric Knowles and Catherine Southon face the antiques showdown, making purchases at four locations before selling at least half of them at auction. In their battle for premium profits and the coveted title of champion, the experts' nerves begin to show

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Chris Evans and Alex Jones present the final show of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ex-rugby union international Martyn Williams, former Olympic athlete Iwan Thomas, motor racing driver Mark Webber and Winter Olympic skeleton champion Amy Williams join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson for another round of the quiz. Presented by Sue Barker

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Carol worries about her first chemotherapy appointment but insists on going alone, while Kat is buzzing with excitement about Alfie's return and heads off to meet him at a hotel - only to be left shell-shocked by an unexpected encounter along the way. Shabnam tries to help Masood get his life back on track, although when Tamwar sees him heading to the Vic it seems their father isn't so interested in helping himself, and he issues him with an ultimatum

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedians Lee Mack and Ruby Wax and Hairy Biker Dave Myers to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include Top Gear, new-age books and chunky chips

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Retired DI Frank Patterson presents the team with information regarding the getaway car used in a 30-year-old safety deposit-box robbery. They discover the former detective not only wants to convict the suspected thief of the heist and murder of his three colleagues, but also prove that a high-ranking officer was involved in the plot - jeopardising the future of Sandra's Ucos unit. Phil Daniels guest stars

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham's guests include British film star Gary Oldman, who appears in the remake of 1987 sci-fi movie RoboCop, and Simon Pegg's right-hand man Nick Frost, who is going it alone as a former salsa prodigy in the dance comedy Cuban Fury. The host also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: Documentary following the fortunes of family-run retail business Poundworld and its CEO Chris Edwards, as he battles his high-street competition. The company's biggest rival, Poundland, reduces all its prices by 3p in East Ham, so Chris retaliates by launching what he thinks is a surefire winner - the Â£1 bra. But will it really attract more shoppers? The boss also thinks he needs to cut back on staff to raise revenue to fund new shops, so he sends his cost-cutting expert back to the shop floor to see whether his plans would damage customer service

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Omnibus. A drunken Masood is mugged and ends up being looked after by Tamwar - but when Aleks arrives with the news about the market office burglary, things soon spiral out of control. Shirley is saddened to hear about Carol's illness, having suffered a cancer scare herself in the past, leading her to make an important phone call. Dexter tries his luck with Nancy, Terry sticks up for Bianca when Nikki oversteps the mark, and Linda is buoyed when she hears about Johnny and Whitney's pregnancy scare, unaware it is fake

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: James Martin is joined by chefs Chris Wheeler and Jason Atherton, while American actress Rashida Jones - star of upcoming film Cuban Fury - faces her food heaven or hell. Peter Richards chooses wine to match the day's dishes, and there are highlights from Celebrity MasterChef, Exploring China: A Culinary Adventure and programmes featuring Rick Stein

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge joins host Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to reveal how the consumer can spend less on food without sacrificing flavour, creating a mouth-watering meal using breast of lamb for just Â£2 a head. Drinks expert Kate Goodman reveals the hidden costs in bargain basement bottles of booze, while comedienne and actress Arabella Weir argues that eating well is not an option for the poorest in society

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests review the week's action, and look ahead to the weekend's Premier League fixtures, which include the early kick-off between Liverpool and Arsenal, and the Welsh derby between Swansea City and Cardiff City

programme.title: Saturday Sportsday
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest sports news, including a look ahead to today's important fixtures and events

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair in Lewes, East Sussex, and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Thomas Plant lends assistance to the blues, and Catherine Southon helps the indecisive reds. Plus, Tim Wonnacott gets a taste of China at Brighton's Royal Pavilion

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Ireland v Wales (Kick-off 2.30pm). Ross Harries introduces all the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, which takes place at the Aviva Stadium, as the sides look to build on their opening weekend victories over Scotland and Italy respectively. Much of the focus ahead of this encounter has been on the expected hostile reception for Wales coach Warren Gatland after he dropped Irish hero Brian O'Driscoll for the third Test of last summer's Lions' tour of Australia, but matters on the pitch between these two sides are usually thrilling enough to relegate such matters to the sidelines. With commentary by Eddie Butler, Philip Matthews and Martyn Williams, and analysis by Keith Wood and Jonathan Davies

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). The second of this afternoon's matches comes from Murrayfield, where the teams also play for the Calcutta Cup. This is the oldest of all international fixtures and one in which England have an excellent recent record, with the Scots' last victory coming in 2008, since when they have lost five and drawn one of the six meetings. Both teams will see claiming a win in this match as vital, as Scotland were beaten in their opener against Ireland, and Stuart Lancaster's men suffered a narrow defeat against France. Presented by John Inverdale, with commentary by Andrew Cotter, Chris Paterson and Brian Moore, and analysis by Clive Woodward, Andy Nicol and Jeremy Guscott

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Spinning-chair singing contest, in which Kylie Minogue, Tom Jones, Will.i.am and Ricky Wilson seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there's a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through `blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Emma Willis and Marvin Humes present

programme.title: The National Lottery
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the game show in which two pairs of strangers team up, each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for Â£100,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up. Includes the Lotto and Thunderball draws presented by Gaby Roslin

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A mountain-bike race between a man and his stepson ends in disaster when both riders lose control - and as the medics examine the boy, they discover old injuries that suggest he might be a victim of abuse. Dixie and Jeff try to extract a man who has got himself stuck in the mudflats by a river, and soon discover he has further problems. Jamie takes the plunge and decides to follow Ramin to Australia, but Robyn and Jeff try to persuade him to stay. Christopher Timothy guest stars

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Swansea City v Cardiff City at the Liberty Stadium. The Gunners were looking for a major boost to their chances of winning the title as they visited the Reds, who may have slipped off the pace over Christmas, but were still aiming for a place in the top four, while the Welsh rivals battled for pride and crucial points. Plus, action from Aston Villa v West Ham United, Chelsea v Newcastle United, Crystal Palace v West Bromwich Albion, Norwich City v Manchester City, Southampton v Stoke City and Sunderland v Hull City

programme.title: The Football League Show
programme.desc: Manish Bhasin presents highlights and all the goals from today's fixtures in the Championship, League One and League Two, including Leicester City v Watford at the King Power Stadium, as the hosts continued their quest to be crowned champions. Plus, action from Yeovil Town v Leeds United and Blackpool v Nottingham Forest

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Swansea City v Cardiff City at the Liberty Stadium. The Gunners were looking for a major boost to their chances of winning the title as they visited the Reds, who may have slipped off the pace over Christmas, but were still aiming for a place in the top four, while the Welsh rivals battled for pride and crucial points. Plus, action from Aston Villa v West Ham United, Chelsea v Newcastle United, Crystal Palace v West Bromwich Albion, Norwich City v Manchester City, Southampton v Stoke City and Sunderland v Hull City

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: The political journalist presents a round-up of the week's stories, interviewing key figures and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents moral and religious discussions on topical issues, live from the Samworth Enterprise Academy in Leicester

programme.title: Sunday Politics
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with the Match of the Day team, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures. This programme is simulcast on BBC Radio 5 Live

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams with cooking in common are challenged to scour London's Camden Passage. While Anita Manning's contestants achieve a huge profit on one item, the team advised by Kate Bliss makes money on all three finds. Presented by Tim Wonnacott

programme.title: The Indian Doctor
programme.desc: As the Thomas brothers begin trying to convince the villagers to back their plan for a new town, Aled and Daf decide they need to do something big to stop Basil's development plan. Prem tells Owen that he cannot work in the mine anymore because of his health, and Megan calls at the surgery with some unexpected news

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: France v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). John Inverdale introduces coverage of the concluding match in the second round of fixtures, which takes place at the Stade de France. The hosts endured a diabolical series of results in 2013, which saw them finish bottom of the Six Nations table, with the Italians one point and two places above them. However, they got off to a winning start at home to England this time around and have never lost at home to Italy, who were beaten away to Wales in their opener. With commentary by Andrew Cotter and Jonathan Davies

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: David Grant revisits the heyday of Sunday School classes, and theatre impresario Bill Kenwright reveals how they helped to establish his beloved Everton Football Club. The host also introduces evergreen hymns and songs from congregations, as well as the School Choirs of the Year

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Fake or Fortune?
programme.desc: The focus turns to Britain's public art collections, in which 17,000 paintings are listed as `artist unknown'. From these Philip Mould and his research director Bendor Grosvenor identify several works they believe are by Thomas Gainsborough. They choose two paintings, the first being an 18th-century portrait of St Albans mayor Joseph Gape that Bendor thinks dates back to the artist's days as a high-society portrait painter - although he'll need to convince the world's leading Gainsborough expert. Philip's choice is a rare landscape, painted when the artist was experimenting with dreamlike scenes. But why is conservationist Aviva Burnstock troubled by a distinctive blue pigment? Last in the series

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A trip to the Lake District, to some of the locations featured in the programme's opening titles. Matt Baker visits the beach the horses race across and Blea Tarn, where the wild swimming was filmed, while Helen Skelton recreates the rock-climbing scene and meets the family who pioneered the sport in the area. Ellie Harrison is also in the Lakes, hearing how the area inspired two different artists - German painter Kurt Schwitters and British poet William Wordsworth. Tom Heap is at Spurn Point in East Yorkshire to find out how this thin spit of land has been damaged by the winter storms and Adam Henson is in Kent to visit one of the most expensive bulls in the world. Including Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star

programme.title: The Musketeers
programme.desc: A former Musketeer unexpectedly returns to Paris, throwing the quartet into turmoil as they are fully aware they should report him for desertion. But he has information on the infamous massacre during which his troop was killed and wants old friend Aramis's help in uncovering the truth. The only problem is, his arrival has coincided with a visit from the king's sister and her husband, the Duke of Savoy - and the regiment have been assigned to protect the royal couple. Swashbuckling drama, with Vincent Regan and JJ Feild

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, which featured Tottenham Hotspur v Everton and Manchester United v Fulham at White Hart Lane and Old Trafford respectively, as the Cottagers looked to boost their chances of avoiding the drop, and the other three clubs aimed to improve their chances of a top-four finish

programme.title: Brooklyn's Finest (2009)
programme.desc: Three Brooklyn police officers find their careers converge at a single moment. A veteran on the brink of retirement is presented with a difficult dilemma, a corrupt cop is willing to do whatever it takes to provide for his family and an undercover officer has grown disillusioned with his role and is ready to step down. Crime thriller, starring Richard Gere, Don Cheadle, Ethan Hawke, Wesley Snipes and Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A chance to catch up with two children aged 10 who are both hard of hearing and have been monitored by the programme since they were five. Yasin has a cochlear implant and is fully mainstreamed with English as his first language, while Lucy has grown up with deaf parents and siblings, and reveals her ambitions for success at the Deaflympics. With voiceover

programme.title: Imagine - Edmund de Waal
programme.desc: Ceramicist Edmund de Waal is perhaps best known as the author of The Hare with Amber Eyes, a family memoir that sold 1.5 million copies worldwide. But despite his success as a writer, he is first and foremost a potter, having made his first piece at the age of five. Alan Yentob follows Edmund for a year as he prepares to exhibit in New York for the first time and also researches his next book, a globe-spanning search for the meaning of white, through the world of porcelain

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - Howard Goodall's Story of Music
programme.desc: The composer examines the history and development of music, beginning by looking back at the first faltering steps humanity took toward creating it. He considers archaeological evidence showing that music was as important in the late Stone Age as it is now and charts how Gregorian chant started with a handful of monks singing the same tune in unison. Over the course of several centuries, medieval musicians painstakingly put together the basics of what has become termed harmony and then added rhythm - the building blocks of the music the world enjoys today

programme.title: Schools - Bringing Books to Life
programme.desc: The series touches on the range of reading experiences available to young people between the ages of seven and 10, as some of the best children's books are explored

programme.title: Schools - Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: A short film revealing the way flamingos move around to display their long necks in a courtship ritual

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a house in Derby, a former church in west London and a three-bedroom semi in Gretna, Dumfries and Galloway. They also follow the properties' sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers help a customer who paid thousands of pounds for a second-hand BMW that turned out to be faulty, while Marc and Tony visit an estate agents in London that took a deposit of Â£1,200 for a flat - yet never handed over the keys

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright explores the case of a father who claimed he was dumped by his wife and left with their newborn baby, only for fraud investigators to discover all was not as it seemed. Plus, the story of a man who struggled to find work after leaving school and faced the prospect of signing-on when his apprenticeship fell through

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: MasterChef's John Torode reaches the letter W in his alphabetical journey through the BBC's culinary archive, highlighting Rick Stein's potato and watercress soup, and the Hairy Bikers' white chocolate cheesecake

programme.title: Italy Unpacked
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon and Giorgio Locatelli embark on a fresh tour of the country, this time travelling down the west coast. They begin in Liguria - a region whose rugged mountains and rocky coastline once inspired English poets of the Romantic era. The pair visit Genoa, where opulent Baroque palaces and celebrated Van Dyke and Strozzi paintings reflect its past as a great maritime republic, before heading on to Cinque Terre - meaning `five lands' - to navigate the scattered villages by boat. Finally, Tuscany beckons the duo, who conclude this leg of their trip by exploring Pistoia, Pisa and Livorno

programme.title: Rip Off Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford unearths more tricks used by some food manufacturers and supermarkets, and the hidden rip-offs that could be lurking in the average consumer's fridge. She compares tap and bottled water to see which comes out on top and investigates the real price of pre-prepared vegetables. Plus, the special offers that may not be quite what they seem. Last in the series

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: Stephen Sackur talks to people making the headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: The day's political news, interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant's journey continues along the north-east coast of England and begins in Hartlepool, Co Durham, where he searches for a missing rock formation. He then heads to North Yorkshire, visiting Saltburn-by-the-Sea and ending his trip in Whitby, where he meets the descendants of a family photographed by Francis Frith

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Lorne Spicer and the team head to Essex, where they hope to help widow Mary Miller clear out a lifetime of collectibles. She wants to raise the funds, along with her close friend Jan, for a special trip

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First of two episodes in which the programme's judges give baking masterclasses from the second series. Mary Berry prepares a coffee and walnut Battenberg, a tarte au citron and brandy snaps, and Paul Hollywood creates a traditional Italian flatbread

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver explores Brittany in northern France, where he meets a lighthouse keeper immortalised in a famous photograph and the last survivors of a French Resistance effort during the Second World War. Nick Crane joins the onion sellers who have delivered their products around the countryside and provided the stereotypical image of the Frenchman for the past 200 years, while Alice Roberts reveals how iodine was discovered. Mark Horton investigates the standing stones at Carnac and Miranda Krestovnikoff dives for a seafood treat

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Steve Backshall reaches the summit of a table-top mountain, after climbing a vertical cliff face nearly as high as the Empire State Building. Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo. Last in the series

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits one of the UK's most famous boxing clubs, before joining Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon as they value antiques in Watford

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo concludes his journey through Italy. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: In February last year, Jeff Bush was asleep at his home in Florida when a sink hole opened up beneath his bedroom. Despite the efforts of his brother to rescue him, Jeff was never seen alive again and his body could not be recovered. Professor Iain Stewart travels to the American state to discover what took Jeff's life and investigate why the geology of the area makes it the sinkhole capital of the world

programme.title: Restoration Home One Year On
programme.desc: Kieran Long revisits Bill and Kim, who turned a crumbling building into a dream holiday home when they started an ambitious architectural transformation of their 16th-century farmhouse in Monmouthshire, with the aid of joiner Sam Thomas. Kieran then heads to Norfolk, where Polly and Eric's attempt to restore the 16th-century Grade II-listed Old Manor had seen them run out of money with little more to show than a crumbling timber skeleton. He discovers what has happened since and how Polly feels about the building into which she sank her life savings. Last in the series

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part two of two. The documentary examines the key role played by royalty in smoothing the path to the Anglo-Russian entente of 1907, and the part played by the Kaiser's erratic, unstable personality in the growing isolation of Germany in the years leading up to 1914. The film also explores the roles played by the German, British and Russian monarchs in the months leading up to the outbreak of the First World War and tells the story of George V's refusal to grant his cousin Nicholas II asylum in England following the Russian Revolution of 1917

programme.title: Charlie Brooker's Weekly Wipe
programme.desc: The writer and broadcaster offers a satirical look at the latest news from politics, the media and the internet, casting a critical eye over trends in TV, cinema, computer games and social media. Plus, regular commentators Philomena and Barry give their own unique takes on the week's biggest stories. With Diane Morgan and Al Campbell

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Don't Panic - The Truth About Population
programme.desc: Statistician Hans Rosling uses state-of-the-art 3D graphics to paint a portrait of a quickly changing world, arguing that the problems of rapid population growth and extreme poverty are beginning to be conquered. Families of two children are now the norm and a smaller proportion of people live in extreme poverty than ever before. Rosling uses an `ignorance survey' to demonstrate how British university graduates would be outperformed by chimpanzees in a test of knowledge about developing countries. Part of the This World strand

programme.title: Educating North Korea - Panorama
programme.desc: A visit to North Korea, revealing a university in the heart of the dictatorship where the sons of the brutal regime are being educated. Chris Rogers spends time on campus to meet the secretive state's future elite

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon investigates ancient routes and shrines across Europe that are still being used, trying to find out whether modern pilgrims are motivated by religious devotion or a sense of adventure. In the French town of St Omer, he finds piles of shoes left on the tomb of a 7th-century saint with notes pleading for children to be cured of their walking difficulties. Simon also visits the Way of St James, a 500-mile route that starts in the French town of St Jean-Pied-du-Port, crosses the Pyrenees, winds through northern Spain and finishes in the holy city of Santiago de Compostela

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - The Charles Dickens Show
programme.desc: Educational programme in which Charles Dickens hosts a chat show. In this edition, he is joined by Thomas Barnardo to discuss the Victorian phenomenon of the workhouse, speaking to an orphan who has lived in one for two years and finding out what a typical menu for the inhabitants would be

programme.title: Schools - The Charles Dickens Show
programme.desc: Educational programme in which Charles Dickens hosts a chat show exploring the issue of health in the Victorian era. The author is joined by Mary Seacole and Florence Nightingale, while Joseph Lister takes on the medical establishment in Ask the Doctors. With a report on cholera from John Snow

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: The author discusses the issue of child labour with reforming peer Lord Shaftesbury, takes questions from ragged schoolchildren and interviews a disreputable factory owner. Plus, a report on youngsters plying their trades on the streets of London

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: Scientist George McGavin helps young people learn more about the processes of rot and decay, and explains the roles they play in the natural world. He investigates the life-cycle of flies, finding out how they play an important part in the natural process of recycling, and analyses microscopic time-lapsed footage of rot

programme.title: Schools - Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: A short film capturing the ways in which ants work together as a team to carry blades of grass back to their colony

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a former office block in Folkestone, Kent, which has been converted into flats, a three-bedroom semi-detached home in Willaston, Cheshire, and a mid-terraced property in Edmonton, London. After three months the team returns to review their progress

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Lawrence and Kev go to a London guitar store to recover money on behalf of a client, while sheriffs Pete and Dave deal with the case of a parking officer who was dismissed from his job and denied the payment he was entitled to

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright looks at the cases of Peter Nicholson, Newham Council's former head of the Youth Offending Team, who received an OBE but was later jailed for stealing money, and a veterinary nurse who feared having to give up work to stay with her young daughter when she showed signs of developmental delay

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode embarks on an alphabetical journey through dishes prepared by an array of TV chefs

programme.title: Cold War, Hot Jets
programme.desc: Part two of two. James Holland explores how the escalating tensions between the superpowers of America and the Soviet Union in the 1950s and 60s led to the jet bomber coming to define how the Cold War was fought. Britain's V-force aircraft were able to fly faster, higher and further than ever before, and were armed with nuclear weapons

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Gillingham in Kent, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include former Labour cabinet minister Tessa Jowell and Respect MP George Galloway

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant travels to Derbyshire, where he visits Francis Frith's home town of Chesterfield and ascends the famous twisted spire. He also explores a medieval country house near Bakewell and enjoys a flutter at the races in Nottingham. Last in the series

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Fiona Inglis, mother of Blue singer Duncan James, invites Lorne Spicer and John Cameron to help her raise enough money to treat her best friend to a day out in London

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry conclude their baking masterclasses, providing recipes and tips to prepare pork pies filled with pork loin and quail's egg, as well as chocolate roulade, traditional iced fingers and Sachertorte

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: An exploration of the history and culture of some of the most extreme locations in Britain. Nick Crane visits the Isles of Scilly, Ruth Goodman walks the dangerous path traversed daily by the Branscombe Cliff farmers in Devon, and Mark Horton investigates the Transatlantic Telegraph service. Meanwhile, Hermione Cockburn learns how the fossil of a large sea creature found at St David's Head, Pembrokeshire, shaped scientists' understanding of Earth's history

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics Opening Ceremony
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces coverage from the Fisht Olympic Stadium in Sochi, Russia, where a spectacular choreographed show signals the official beginning of the XXII Olympic Winter Games. Over the next 16 days, the world's finest will gather in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana to compete in 15 sports in front of a huge global audience, as they aim to write themselves into the history books as another chapter of the Olympic story is written. The event builds to the lighting of the Olympic Flame, which has been into space as part of its journey, as Russia hosts the Winter Games for the first occasion in their history. Hazel Irvine leads the commentary team. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part one of two. Steered by his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo explores Germany and learns how tourists in the early 20th century would have been visiting a relatively new country, which they admired and envied but also feared. He learns about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to take their place in the black chair, where they answer questions on the snooker world championship from 1977 to the present date, the musicals of Alan Jay Lerner and Frederick Loewe, the novels of American mystery writer Cara Black, and 16th-century monarch Phillip II of Spain. They then have a chance to demonstrate their general knowledge in the final round

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.desc: It is a busy time for many as Easter approaches, with Jo Birch getting popular attraction La Seigneurie Gardens ready for the start of the tourist season. Shepherd Dave Scott is bracing himself for the onset of lambing and Bas needs to get his fishing boat painted in time, but a blizzard and a force-nine gale throw many plans into disarray

programme.title: Torvill & Dean
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day in 1984, British ice-dancing pair Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean skated into the record books when their routine to music from Ravel's Bolero received the highest set of marks ever awarded, including nine perfect scores of 6 for artistic impression. This documentary tells the story of the performance, with contributions by Torvill and Dean

programme.title: Alan Davies Apres-Ski
programme.desc: New series. The comedian and a selection of guests from the worlds of comedy, entertainment and sport take an irreverent look at all the news and action from the Winter Olympics in Sochi, celebrating what makes the Games special

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Passchendaele (2008)
programme.desc: A Canadian soldier is injured in battle during the First World War, and falls for a nurse in the hospital. Declared unfit for duty due to ill health, he is reassigned to a recruitment station - but he tricks his way back to the front line to protect the brother of the woman he loves. Drama, directed by and starring Paul Gross. With Caroline Dhavernas and Joe Dinicol

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Gillingham in Kent, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include former Labour cabinet minister Tessa Jowell and Respect MP George Galloway

programme.title: Secrets of the Sales
programme.desc: Cherry Healey is granted behind-the-scenes access to some of the high street's biggest retailers to find out how sales work from the inside. She is allowed into a critical meeting as prices and strategy are decided, learns how some shops use scents to influence customers' behaviour and meets one sofa manufacture who admits furniture sales can be a psychological trick. But this isn't just about insider information - Cherry also discovers the way the thrill of bargain-hunting can affect shoppers' bodies

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Annie Oakley (1935)
programme.desc: Biopic of the sharpshooter, examining her rise to fame with Buffalo Bill Cody's Wild West Show. She falls for a fellow marksman, who teaches her the art of showmanship, but as she becomes the troupe's star attraction, jealous rivalry drives a wedge between them. Starring Barbara Stanwyck and Preston Foster

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the opening day of the Games in Russia, featuring snowboarding and cross-country skiing. The first live event to be featured is the final of the men's slopestyle snowboarding from 8.45 at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, which also hosted the earlier semi-finals, where Britain's Billy Morgan is a genuine medal contender, having finished fourth at last year's World Championships. Commentary comes from Ed Leigh and Tim Warwood. The first women's gold will be decided in the 15km skiathlon cross-country discipline at 10.00 at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex near Krasnaya Polyana, where Norway's Marit Bjoergen will be hoping to add to her already impressive Olympic medal haul. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A chance to catch up with two children aged 10 who are both hard of hearing and have been monitored by the programme since they were five. Aidan previously suffered with speech dyspraxia but has now caught up and his hearing has improved following a second cochlear implant, and Amie's schoolwork continues to get better after having received the same help. With voiceover

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the first leg of his second journey, Michael Portillo heads to Kirkcaldy in Fife, finding out along the way how the mill town of Preston in Lancashire gave birth to the Temperance Movement. In Blackpool, he enjoys a performance in the Tower Ballroom and discovers the railways had a direct impact on the town's birth as a resort. After a stroll along the pier with local comedian Joey Blower, Michael visits Morecambe Bay

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off Revisited
programme.desc: Highlights of the first series of the bakery competition as past contestants reflect on their roles in the programme and how it has affected their lives. Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood also provide their personal accounts and memories of the contest. Last in the series

programme.title: Easy Virtue (2008)
programme.desc: A naive Englishman in the 1920s embarks on a passionate romance with a glamorous and sophisticated American while in the south of France, resulting in a hasty wedding. However, when he takes her home to meet his upper-class family, his mother is horrified by the turn of events, while his father seems to have something else on his mind. Romantic comedy based on Noel Coward's play, starring Jessica Biel, Ben Barnes, Kristin Scott Thomas and Colin Firth

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces further coverage of day one in Russia, where speed skating and biathlon are the sports making their first appearances in the 2014 Games. The opening action of the afternoon features highlights from the Adler Arena in Sochi at 2.30, where the speed skating schedule got under way with the men's 5,000m, the longest discipline in the sport at these Games, and one in which Sven Kramer of the Netherlands entered as the reigning champion. Attention switches at 3.15 to the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex near Krasnaya Polyana, and live coverage of the men's biathlon 10km sprint. Norway are one of the nations with a proud record in the Winter Games at this sport and at 40, Ole Einar Bjoerndalen is set to appear in an incredible sixth Olympics, and is looking to add to a medal haul that consists of six gold, four silver and one bronze. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, Football League and Scotland

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding takes over the presenting duties for the final coverage from the opening day of the Games, featuring figure skating, luge and freestyle skiing. The team figure skating disciplines have been added to the Games this year for the first time and there are highlights of the short dance and ladies' free programmes at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi from 5.10. Sue Barker and Robin Cousins provide the commentary. Action from the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana is also scheduled at this time, featuring the first and second runs in the men's luge singles, with Britain's Adam Rosen competing in his third Games. The concluding live coverage of the day comes from Rosa Khutor Extreme Park near Krasnaya Polyana, where the first freestyle skiing medals of the Games are decided from 6.00 in the women's moguls final. America's Hannah Kearney won the gold four years ago in Vancouver and also clinched the world crown last year, and is aiming for a repeat performance before retiring from the sport. Matt Chilton is the commentator. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from the opening day in Russia, where the first five gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Biathlon, cross-country skiing, freestyle skiing, snowboarding and speed skating were the sports to crown new champions on the first day, with the men's slopestyle snowboarding making its debut at the Games. Its introduction is a timely one for Britain's Billy Morgan, who has overcome injury to take his place among the favourites, and the 24-year-old finished last season ranked second in the world, and came fourth in the 2013 World Championships. A number of Winter Olympic legends were also expected to be in action, including Norwegian duo Marit Bjoergen and Ole Einar Bjoerndalen, who entered the Games with nine gold medals between them in cross-country skiing and biathlon respectively

programme.title: Torvill & Dean
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day in 1984, British ice-dancing pair Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean skated into the record books when their routine to music from Ravel's Bolero received the highest set of marks ever awarded, including nine perfect scores of 6 for artistic impression. This documentary tells the story of the performance, with contributions by Torvill and Dean

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: War Weapons Week is to be marked in Walmington-on-Sea by a parade of all auxiliary services, including air-raid wardens, fire brigade, nurses, the rescue squad and of course, the Home Guard. Mainwaring decides the platoon needs a mascot for the event and plumps for a ram, but catching a suitable candidate for the job proves easier said than done. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe, Clive Dunn and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Hanif Kureishi
programme.desc: Author, playwright and screenwriter Hanif Kureishi has amused, provoked and annoyed since breaking through with the script for 1985 film My Beautiful Laundrette. In this programme, Kureishi chats to Alan Yentob about his new book The Last Word, his latest film Le Week-End and placing his personal archive in the vaults of the British Library. With contributions by directors Stephen Frears and Roger Michell and producer Kevin Loader

programme.title: My Beautiful Laundrette (1985)
programme.desc: An ambitious Asian teenager joins forces with a former National Front member to open a trendy laundrette, but as the project develops, so does the boys' relationship - leading to mixed feelings and racial tension. Stephen Frears' comedy drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis, Gordon Warnecke and Saeed Jaffrey. Written by Hanif Kureishi

programme.title: The Mother (2003)
programme.desc: A lonely widow decides to move in with her daughter, yearning for the company of her children and grandchildren, but their new domestic arrangement causes problems when the older woman embarks on an ill-advised but passionate affair with a much younger man - who just happens to be her offspring's boyfriend. Drama by writer Hanif Kureishi, starring Anne Reid, Daniel Craig, Cathryn Bradshaw and Steven Mackintosh

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the opening session on day two of the Games. The snowboarding gets the day's action under way at the Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, Russia, with the first run in the women's slopestyle semi-final at 6.30, followed by the second run at 8.00, and concluding with the final at 9.15, with Britain's Jenny Jones expected to be a realistic medal contender, having won three X Games golds in recent years. The alpine skiing takes place at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort and begins with the blue riband event of the Games - the men's downhill at 7.00. Switzerland's Didier Defago claimed gold four years ago in Canada, winning by a margin of just seven hundredths of a second. Matt Chilton and Graham Bell are the commentators. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: James Martin presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: The Gumball Rally (1976)
programme.desc: A wealthy man sponsors a madcap illegal coast-to-coast motor race from New York to California, prompting a host of eccentric characters to take to the road in their customised cars. However, a bungling police detective is determined to put a stop to the racers' antics. Comedy, starring Michael Sarrazin, Tim McIntire, Raul Julia and Gary Busey

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces further coverage of the second day from Russia, featuring cross-country skiing and speed skating highlights from 2.30, live biathlon from 3.00 and live figure skating and luge from 3.30. The cross-country at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex near Krasnaya Polyana featured the men's 30km skiathlon discipline, while the medals were decided in the speed skating at the Adler Arena in Sochi, in the women's 3,000m event. The biathlon at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex sees the women's 7.5km sprint medals confirmed, and the figure skating features the inaugural staging of the men's team category at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, interspersed with the third and penultimate run in the men's singles luge at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents concluding coverage from the second day of the Games in Russia, featuring figure skating and luge from 5.10, and ski jumping from 6.30. The team figure skating concludes with the team free ice dance discipline at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, while the men's singles luge reaches a climax with the fourth run at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana. Attention then switches to the first ski jumping medals to be decided at the RusSki Gorki Jumping Centre in Krasnaya Polyana, where the competitors take on the second and final jump in the men's individual Normal Hill event. The ski jumping medals in Vancouver were shared by five nations, but Simon Amman was the star of the Games, winning both this event and the Large Hill, although Switzerland finished outside the medals in the team discipline, which was won by Austria. This year's Games will also feature a women's jump, which takes place at this venue on Tuesday. Paul Dickenson and Colin Bryce are the commentators for the luge. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day two in Russia, where eight gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. The alpine skiing was one of the sports to get under way today, as the men's downhill garnered much of the attention on the slopes at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort, while the inaugural women's snowboarding slopestyle champion was crowned at the Rosa Khutor Extreme Park, and the women's ice hockey group match between Russia and Germany took place at the Shayba Arena in Sochi. The men's downhill is traditionally seen as the blue riband event of any Games, and Didier Defago of Switzerland won the gold medal four years ago in Vancouver, with Norway's Aksel Lund Svindal a close second and Bode Miller of the USA in third. Miller's medal helped his country to an outstanding haul of eight, twice as many as their nearest rivals Norway and Austria

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: More hopefuls bid to win funding for their projects from the panel. A couple go all-out to gain interest in their glamorous camping business, a mother-of-four from Shropshire has a new take on the coffee bag and the Dragons are in for a surprise when an entrepreneur attempts to graffiti the Den. Evan Davis presents

programme.title: Alan Davies Apres-Ski
programme.desc: The comedian and a selection of guests from the worlds of comedy, entertainment and sport take an irreverent look at all the news and action from the Winter Olympics in Sochi, celebrating what makes the Games special

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents an extended version of the quiz, and unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary examining what impact the relationships between cousins Nicholas II of Russia, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany and George V of the United Kingdom had on the outbreak of the First World War. This episode focuses on the story of the emerging divisions and rivalries between the inter-related royal houses of Europe during the 19th century. Featuring contributions by historians Karina Urbach, Miranda Carter and Piers Brendon. Tamsin Greig narrates

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A possessive painter who fears his ex-wife will expose his dark secrets resorts to killing her, but makes it appear she drowned. However, Columbo is unconvinced and draws on his broad palette of experience to reveal the truth. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Patrick Bauchau and Fionnula Flanagan

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: Daybreak
programme.desc: Actress Emily Watson speaks about her new film The Book Thief, based on the best-selling novel by Markus Zusak. Plus, news and current affairs, health, entertainment and lifestyle features, presented by Matt Barbet, Ranvir Singh, Lorraine Kelly and Aled Jones

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Jill Halfpenny talks about working with Danny Boyle on his new police comedy/drama series Babylon, which is written by Peep Show and Four Lions creators Sam Bain and Jesse Armstrong. Plus, entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines, viewers' comments in the Hub and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. Including at 11.25 ITV News and Regional Weather

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Ruth Langsford hosts the topical debate alongside panellists including Nadia Sawalha. They are joined by Call the Midwife stars Jenny Agutter and Laura Main

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson travels to Liverpool with a team of dealers to value people's antiques. A plaque of the Duke of Wellington turns up on Henry Nicholls' table, while a limited edition Royal Doulton jug excites Alison Chapman

programme.title: The Alan Titchmarsh Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by celebrity guests, along with regular contributors royal hairdresser Richard Ward and stylist and musician Myleene Klass

programme.title: ITV London Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Britain's Best Bakery
programme.desc: Three bakeries from Kent and Sussex compete, including a father-and-son team who cook up some Italian food. A pair of bread gurus take inspiration from the classic dessert Black Forest gateau, and a cupcake-making couple feel the pressure when they are challenged to make some savoury cheese straws

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: At a meal to celebrate Georgia's return from Canada, Priya makes her excuses and leaves her food, leading to a confrontation with a suspicious Leyla. Megan learns Charity is not only her new business partner but is also moving in, while Jai tries to talk round a distraught Sam. Marlon and Nicola enhance Bernice's dating profile and Ruby is still bitter over Bob's accusation of theft

programme.title: Who Wants to Work Forever?
programme.desc: Large numbers in the UK are failing to save enough money for a comfortable retirement, and with an increase to the age at which people become eligible for the state pension, many face a future of working well into their golden years. Fiona Foster looks at some of the ways in which people are extending their careers and examines the scale of the pension crisis

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Priya takes a plate of food upstairs and tries to force herself to eat it, while Leyla shares her concerns with Alicia, who then tells David - but warns him not to go blundering in. programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon's estranged husband Chris gets in touch asking for a divorce so he can marry his new girlfriend Angie, but Tracey has her doubts. programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Madge comes to terms with bad news from her doctor and makes the most of her last few days in the sun, while Mick braces himself to tell the family about her diagnosis. He's keen to ensure they use the cheapest food available, and the resulting hog roast leads to the contestants taking on more than they bargained for

programme.desc: After Michelle forces Steve to sleep on the sofa, he makes his feelings clear to Andrea - but will she reveal her own? However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents

programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Supersize vs Superskinny
programme.desc: Mick Wickes survives on very little food and drinks 25 cups of tea a day, each containing five spoonfuls of sugar. He meets 22st takeaway fan Charlene Shattock for a diet swap filled with drama and tension. Christian Jessen visits a weight-loss clinic in Las Vegas and reporter Emma Woolf interviews Valeria Levitin, who has been battling anorexia for more than 20 years

programme.title: Big Ballet
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following plus-size amateur dancers as they attempt to realise their dreams of performing scenes from Swan Lake on stage. Under the guidance of choreographer Wayne Sleep and prima ballerina Monica Loughman, the troupe sets out to ruffle feathers and break one of the biggest taboos in the ballet world - weight. In the first edition, more than 200 auditionees are whittled down to just 18. Narrated by Olivia Colman

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets Emily, a Croydon girl with stretched earlobes, a huge tattoo on her chest and piercings all over her face and body. Now, Emily is desperate to get her natural look back, but will it be possible? Meanwhile, Jodie, a 23-year-old beautician from Luton, wants to take her body modifications to the next level by getting permanent holes punched through the top of her ears, and Pete has serious regrets about a tattoo that has made him a laughing stock among his friends

programme.title: My Baggy Body
programme.desc: The dramatic increase in weight-loss surgery in the last decade has left thousands of people with large amounts of excess skin, but with the NHS restricting subsequent cosmetic procedures, many of them are unhappy in their newly slim bodies. This First Cut documentary tells the stories of Sarah, Gregg and Pauline, who are trying to cope with a distressing side effect of shedding 43 stone between them

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while 58-year-old mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates the nation's cod consumption and looks at how the fish is imported from Iceland in large quantities. Kate Quilton finds out why most British supermarkets stock only one variety of banana and heads to Malaysia to learn about a disease threatening the future of the popular fruit. Matt Tebbutt examines popcorn production, revealing why eating bucketloads of it might not satisfy a person's appetite

programme.title: Health Freaks

programme.desc: Kate encourages Bulldog to continue his audience-grabbing practical jokes against Frasier, who decides to exact a suitable revenge - blissfully unaware that such pranks have a nasty habit of backfiring. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Dan Butler

programme.desc: The shrink is up for a prestigious title at his wine club and offers to host the next tasting in his apartment. programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under

Comedy, directed by Leonard Nimoy, starring Tom Selleck, Ted Danson, Steve Guttenberg and Nancy Travis. Edited for language

programme.title: Scandimania
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall arrives in Denmark as his Scandinavian adventure continues. In Copenhagen, he cooks with Rene Redzepi, owner of the award-winning restaurant Noma, before meeting actor Soren Malling, star of The Killing and Borgen, and architect Bjarke Ingels, who explains his concept of hedonistic sustainability. Leaving the Danish capital, Hugh visits an Efterskole - a boarding school where teenagers are taught how to be good citizens - and finishes this leg of the tour on the idyllic island of Samso, where he cooks up a feast with fellow chef Kasper Gaard

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: Police comedy drama, directed by Danny Boyle, written by Sam Bain and Jesse Armstrong (Peep Show, Fresh Meat). The Met is in need of a public image revamp, so chief constable Richard Miller has hired American visionary Liz Garvey to revolutionise the force's PR department. In an age of rolling news, smartphones and an information-hungry population, Liz preaches transparency and honesty. But as an outbreak of violence erupts across London and internal backbiting begins, her mission faces its greatest test. Starring James Nesbitt, Brit Marling, Jill Halfpenny, Paterson Joseph, Bertie Carvel and Adam Deacon

programme.title: The Bank Job (2008)
programme.desc: A London car dealer is persuaded by an old flame to rob a bank. The heist goes off without a hitch, leaving the crooks in possession of cash and jewels worth millions - as well as a safety deposit box containing top-secret information the government and security services are determined to keep buried. Fact-based crime thriller, starring Jason Statham and Saffron Burrows

programme.title: Don't Look Down
programme.desc: Documentary exploring one of the world's most dangerous and terrifying new crazes - urban free-climbing - where daredevils scale cranes and buildings without safety equipment and hang hundreds of feet above the ground, one slip from certain death. The film follows 23-year-old James Kingston as he tackles radio towers in Southampton, before travelling to the spiritual home of urban free-climbing - Ukraine - where he teams up with the infamous climber Mustang Wanted to push himself further than ever, culminating in Mustang's latest death-defying stunt on Moscow Bridge in Kiev

programme.title: Random Acts

programme.title: Control (2007)
programme.desc: Biopic of Ian Curtis, the troubled lead singer of Joy Division, who took his own life at the age of 23. As the band rise to success in the post-punk era of the late 1970s, Curtis struggles with the pressures of fame, a failing marriage, uncontrollable epilepsy and an affair with a Belgian journalist. Based on the book Touching from a Distance by Curtis' wife Deborah, and starring Sam Riley and Samantha Morton

programme.title: Cloak and Dagger (1946)
programme.desc: An American nuclear scientist undertakes a secret mission to Europe to gather information on Germany's atomic research programme during the Second World War. Put under the care of Italian partisans, he falls in love with an anti-fascist fighter who helps him in his dangerous quest. Spy thriller, starring Gary Cooper, Lilli Palmer, Robert Alda and Vladimir Sokoloff

programme.desc: Mick Wickes survives on very little food and drinks 25 cups of tea a day, each containing five spoonfuls of sugar. He meets 22st takeaway fan Charlene Shattock for a diet swap filled with drama and tension. Christian Jessen visits a weight-loss clinic in Las Vegas and reporter Emma Woolf interviews Valeria Levitin, who has been battling anorexia for more than 20 years

programme.title: Big Ballet
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following plus-size amateur dancers as they attempt to realise their dreams of performing scenes from Swan Lake on stage. Under the guidance of choreographer Wayne Sleep and prima ballerina Monica Loughman, the troupe sets out to ruffle feathers and break one of the biggest taboos in the ballet world - weight. In the first edition, more than 200 auditionees are whittled down to just 18. Narrated by Olivia Colman

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets Emily, a Croydon girl with stretched earlobes, a huge tattoo on her chest and piercings all over her face and body. Now, Emily is desperate to get her natural look back, but will it be possible? Meanwhile, Jodie, a 23-year-old beautician from Luton, wants to take her body modifications to the next level by getting permanent holes punched through the top of her ears, and Pete has serious regrets about a tattoo that has made him a laughing stock among his friends

programme.title: My Baggy Body
programme.desc: The dramatic increase in weight-loss surgery in the last decade has left thousands of people with large amounts of excess skin, but with the NHS restricting subsequent cosmetic procedures, many of them are unhappy in their newly slim bodies. This First Cut documentary tells the stories of Sarah, Gregg and Pauline, who are trying to cope with a distressing side effect of shedding 43 stone between them

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while 58-year-old mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight

programme.title: Random Acts

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates the nation's cod consumption and looks at how the fish is imported from Iceland in large quantities. Kate Quilton finds out why most British supermarkets stock only one variety of banana and heads to Malaysia to learn about a disease threatening the future of the popular fruit. programme.title: Hunted

programme.title: Floods
