programme.desc: Tula and Iver make a bid for fame in the hope of featuring in a glossy magazine - but Groove struggles to cope with the pressures of being a household name

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Frank are pressured by their wives to join Robert in one of his therapy sessions - but the three of them decide to go to the racetrack instead

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kate and Frasier decide to take their relationship slowly, until their passion gets the better of them in the radio booth and their steamy encounter is broadcast over the airwaves - leaving the whole of Seattle trying to work out the identity of `dirty girl'. Comedy, guest starring Mercedes Ruehl, with Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles reaches the end of his tether with Maris, and decides to retaliate - but she turns the tables by throwing him out and asking for a divorce. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: The Taste
programme.desc: The contestants use recipes passed down through the generations to impress Nigella Lawson, Anthony Bourdain and Ludo Lefebvre, and emotions run high as they try to do their mothers and fathers, grandparents and godparents proud. However, after the blind tastings another cook has to head home. The immunity challenge is set by guest chef Ruth Rogers, owner of the famous River Cafe in London

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by comedian Richard Herring, who talks about his tour, presenter Jamie Theakston, who discusses his radio show and actor Kayvan Novak and actress Alexandra Roach who chat about their roles in the film Cuban Fury. Plus, rock band We Are Scientists perform Make It Easy, and as always the guests contribute to the playlist by providing snippets of their favourite tracks

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is fired for being disrespectful to his boss, and explores new activities in a bid to find a purpose in life other than physics, but Leonard takes drastic action to restore him to his old self. Laurie Metcalf guest stars as Sheldon's mother

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The friends miss the Super Bowl to attend a barman's funeral, and make a pact not to find out the score until the next day. However, adhering to the agreement proves difficult with people all around them discussing the game. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted misses his flight to Chicago for a job interview at a prestigious architecture company, so he and Robin retrace their steps to determine who is to blame. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is appointed Springfield's new sanitation commissioner, but finds it so hard to keep his elaborate election promises that he is forced to spend the year's budget allocation in his first month in charge. Featuring the guest voices of U2 and Steve Martin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Two company executives hire Homer to climb Springfield's most treacherous mountain, the ominously named Murderhorn, as a promotional stunt for their product. With the guest voice of Brendan Fraser

programme.title: Three Men and a Baby (1987)
programme.desc: The lives of three flat-sharing bachelors are turned upside down when they discover a baby left on their doorstep. Unfortunately, while trying to get to grips with the necessary parenting skills, they find themselves menaced by criminals searching for missing drugs. Comedy, directed by Leonard Nimoy, starring Tom Selleck, Ted Danson, Steve Guttenberg and Nancy Travis. Edited for language

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Contestants try to beat the banker and guess the contents of mystery boxes to win a big-money prize. In a game-changing twist, players could now win up to Â£500,000 by doubling their winnings with box 23 - if they are brave enough to buy it with what they have already won. Presented by Noel Edmonds

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a Sunday roast and curry fusion, Jimmy Doherty builds a DIY smoker and the pair try to bring back a long-forgotten pudding in Colchester. Their guest in the kitchen is former Radio 1 DJ Chris Moyles, who prepares his favourite dish - a New York-style pizza

programme.title: Scandimania
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall arrives in Denmark as his Scandinavian adventure continues. In Copenhagen, he cooks with Rene Redzepi, owner of the award-winning restaurant Noma, before meeting actor Soren Malling, star of The Killing and Borgen, and architect Bjarke Ingels, who explains his concept of hedonistic sustainability. Leaving the Danish capital, Hugh visits an Efterskole - a boarding school where teenagers are taught how to be good citizens - and finishes this leg of the tour on the idyllic island of Samso, where he cooks up a feast with fellow chef Kasper Gaard

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: Police comedy drama, directed by Danny Boyle, written by Sam Bain and Jesse Armstrong (Peep Show, Fresh Meat). The Met is in need of a public image revamp, so chief constable Richard Miller has hired American visionary Liz Garvey to revolutionise the force's PR department. In an age of rolling news, smartphones and an information-hungry population, Liz preaches transparency and honesty. But as an outbreak of violence erupts across London and internal backbiting begins, her mission faces its greatest test. Starring James Nesbitt, Brit Marling, Jill Halfpenny, Paterson Joseph, Bertie Carvel and Adam Deacon

programme.title: The Bank Job (2008)
programme.desc: A London car dealer is persuaded by an old flame to rob a bank. The heist goes off without a hitch, leaving the crooks in possession of cash and jewels worth millions - as well as a safety deposit box containing top-secret information the government and security services are determined to keep buried. Fact-based crime thriller, starring Jason Statham and Saffron Burrows

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: The return of the programme in which Ben Fogle meets people who have moved to inhospitable parts of the world after leaving the rat race behind. He begins by travelling to the swamplands of southern Georgia in America to spend time with 64-year-old Colbert, a former financier who now lives in his hand-built wooden cabin. Ben learns some of the vital skills needed to survive in this dangerous backwater, including skinning roadkill, spearing frogs and drinking swamp water

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to would-be sellers in Cotham, Bristol, whose four-bedroom bungalow has been on the market for four months. programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits a struggling hotel and nightclub in Essex run by members of the Dolbear family, who spend more time arguing than looking after their customers' needs. She soon detects a battle of the sexes, with father and son Jeff and Andy shouting down mum and daughter Marilyn and Shelley when it comes to decision-making. The garish decor does not help - and to top it off, Jeff remains blind to the business's problems. Alex discovers the rest of the family called her in against his wishes, and he now says he will ignore all her advice

programme.title: Building the London Underground
programme.desc: One-off documentary charting four of the main technological advances that have helped make the Tube the second-biggest metro system in the world, including tunnel-boring methods developed in the 1880s and a new form of train propulsion invented for the New York City Subway. The programme also reveals how the Tube owes a debt to the engineers at the Paris Metro for their subterranean station designs, and the safety precautions that are in place to protect passengers in the event of a fire

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Dex assumes control of the wedding preparations when he and April are unable to agree on a best man or a maid of honour. programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: It's the day of Josh's Commonwealth Games trials and tension builds as everyone gathers at the Turners' house to watch him in action - but things get off to a shaky start for the swimmer. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: The crusading lawyer takes on a custody case, only for his client to later confess to having murdered the psychiatrist who testified against him. programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As Britain endures a cold snap, there is chaos on the roads as snow, ice and freezing fog conditions persist. RAC patrols battle to reach snowed-in motorists, while heavy-recovery specialists CMG Rescue Services are out 24 hours a day tackling the aftermath of overturned HGVs and traffic collisions. In Bournemouth, RAC patroller Louise French is first on the scene at a serious accident and has to treat a casualty as she waits for the ambulance to arrive. Last in the series

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Real-life footage brings to life how some survived against both the odds and the elements, how some were found despite having no means of communicating with the outside world, and how others were not so lucky. Including film from the helmet camera of skier Kristoffer Carlsson, who was buried alive under two metres of snow in Verbier, Switzerland, after triggering an avalanche

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: New series. Alex Polizzi comes to the rescue of more struggling hotels, beginning with a visit to Epstein House in Liverpool where owner Patrick Duggan is having problems keeping his business afloat. The property was the home of the Beatles' manager Brian Epstein and Patrick was sure the guest house would be highly profitable when he bought it five years ago, but such expectations have yet to be realised

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: New series. The return of the documentary following patients undergoing surgery at Liverpool's Walton Centre, which is the only specialist neuroscience NHS Trust. Father-of-three Dene Galloway is rushed to hospital following a sudden headache and neurosurgeon Michael Jenkinson has to operate when the growth in his brain bleeds. Neurologist Nicholas Silver treats 52-year-old Helga Kristensen, who has developed a cluster headache that is causing her excruciating pain, while Iona Davies' epilepsy is not responding well to drugs and her doctors think that surgery might offer a solution

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Rita Lowman is trapped in a lift as its ceiling catches fire and is burned alive, with security footage proving that arsonist Leonard Brooks tampered with the machinery. When a man dies after eating a sandwich spiked with a substance that causes a fiery chemical reaction with his stomach acid, Mac and the team must find the connection between the victims before Brooks strikes again. Crime drama, guest starring Rob Morrow, with Gary Sinise and Natalie Martinez

programme.title: She's 78, He's 39
programme.desc: Six people whose partners are much younger than they are reveal why being of different generations is no barrier to romance. Marilyn's relationship with husband William began when she was 45 and he was 16 and was tested from the start by abuse from friends and neighbours, while Edna (78) and Simon (39) bonded over their mutual love of organ music. Mike (74) is coping with an eight-week-old baby alongside wife Lindsey, who is 41 years his junior, while 58-year-old Gary enjoys clubbing in Ibiza with his spouse Kate, who is half his age

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: A look at the origins of the sci-fi show created by Gene Roddenberry in the 1960s, which spawned four TV spin-offs and a movie franchise. Featuring interviews with the producer of the original series Herb Solow, Roddenberry's son Rod, star Leonard Nimoy (Mr Spock) and fan club members Bjo and John Trimble, the film charts Roddenberry's rise to fame and how he went to extraordinary lengths to keep his creation on air

programme.title: World's Scariest Animal Attacks
programme.desc: Terrifying encounters caught on camera by ordinary people. A diver narrates his own shocking footage of a great white shark breaking open his cage with its jaws. A giant anaconda sinks its teeth into a Brazilian policeman, an agitated elephant charges a honeymooning British couple on an African safari and a lion turns on its handler at an awards ceremony. Plus, chimpanzees on the loose in Northern Ireland and a frightening incident at a bullring

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Conrad and Philip Bruns. Part of the Murder Mysteries strand

programme.title: Building the London Underground
programme.desc: One-off documentary charting four of the main technological advances that have helped make the Tube the second-biggest metro system in the world, including tunnel-boring methods developed in the 1880s and a new form of train propulsion invented for the New York City Subway. The programme also reveals how the Tube owes a debt to the engineers at the Paris Metro for their subterranean station designs, and the safety precautions that are in place to protect passengers in the event of a fire

programme.desc: Part two of two. programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As Britain endures a cold snap, there is chaos on the roads as snow, ice and freezing fog conditions persist. RAC patrols battle to reach snowed-in motorists, while heavy-recovery specialists CMG Rescue Services are out 24 hours a day tackling the aftermath of overturned HGVs and traffic collisions. In Bournemouth, RAC patroller Louise French is first on the scene at a serious accident and has to treat a casualty as she waits for the ambulance to arrive. Last in the series

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Real-life footage brings to life how some survived against both the odds and the elements, how some were found despite having no means of communicating with the outside world, and how others were not so lucky. Including film from the helmet camera of skier Kristoffer Carlsson, who was buried alive under two metres of snow in Verbier, Switzerland, after triggering an avalanche

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: New series. Alex Polizzi comes to the rescue of more struggling hotels, beginning with a visit to Epstein House in Liverpool where owner Patrick Duggan is having problems keeping his business afloat. The property was the home of the Beatles' manager Brian Epstein and Patrick was sure the guest house would be highly profitable when he bought it five years ago, but such expectations have yet to be realised

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: New series. The return of the documentary following patients undergoing surgery at Liverpool's Walton Centre, which is the only specialist neuroscience NHS Trust. Father-of-three Dene Galloway is rushed to hospital following a sudden headache and neurosurgeon Michael Jenkinson has to operate when the growth in his brain bleeds. Neurologist Nicholas Silver treats 52-year-old Helga Kristensen, who has developed a cluster headache that is causing her excruciating pain, while Iona Davies' epilepsy is not responding well to drugs and her doctors think that surgery might offer a solution

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Rita Lowman is trapped in a lift as its ceiling catches fire and is burned alive, with security footage proving that arsonist Leonard Brooks tampered with the machinery. When a man dies after eating a sandwich spiked with a substance that causes a fiery chemical reaction with his stomach acid, Mac and the team must find the connection between the victims before Brooks strikes again. Crime drama, guest starring Rob Morrow, with Gary Sinise and Natalie Martinez

programme.title: She's 78, He's 39
programme.desc: Six people whose partners are much younger than they are reveal why being of different generations is no barrier to romance. Marilyn's relationship with husband William began when she was 45 and he was 16 and was tested from the start by abuse from friends and neighbours, while Edna (78) and Simon (39) bonded over their mutual love of organ music. Mike (74) is coping with an eight-week-old baby alongside wife Lindsey, who is 41 years his junior, while 58-year-old Gary enjoys clubbing in Ibiza with his spouse Kate, who is half his age

programme.desc: Alex Polizzi tackles the Caspian, a 10-bedroom hotel in Ealing, west London, that desperately needs to be brought up to date to attract more guests. Co-owner Nousha Samari has spent more than four decades in the hospitality business, but is frustrated by how unsuccessful her establishment has become - and the stress is beginning to show in her relationship with son and business partner Samandar

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jon puts his body on the line as he tackles a drunken youth in a domestic dispute and Martin turns detective to catch a drink-driver who thinks she can get one over on the interceptors. Elsewhere, a speeding motorist causes chaos after crashing into a gas main, Doug gets to grips with a burglar and the hunt is on for Lincoln's answer to Harry Houdini. Documentary following the work of Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: April forces Casey and Tamara into serving as best man and maid of honour, unaware of their decision to split up, and also gets good news from Paris. Bianca is delighted to tell Casey that his application for special consideration has been granted and he will be awarded his Higher School Certificate, while Ms Montgomery seems to be going completely off the rails

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amber fears for the future when she discovers Josh will be spending three months at a training camp in Spain - and starts making plans to join him abroad. Terese worries that Imogen has relapsed into her bingeing habits after some food goes missing, while Toadie is devastated to learn about Jacob kissing Sonya

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: An unidentified woman found dead in an alleyway appears to have taken a heroin overdose, but further inspection reveals someone may have had a hand in administering the fatal drugs. Mac recognises the victim as conspiracy-obsessed Tessa James, and as he works to explore whether there was truth in her stories, the investigation leads to an elite gentlemen's club that has traces of blood on the walls. Starring Gary Sinise and Sela Ward

programme.title: While I Was Gone (2004)
programme.desc: An unhappily married vet wonders how her life would have changed if she had made different decisions in the past. When she is called out to treat a dog that may have to be put down, she discovers the owner is an old friend from her university days, only adding to her emotional turmoil. Drama, starring Kirstie Alley, Bill Smitrovich, Peter Horton and Janaya Stephens. Edited for violence and language

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amber fears for the future when she discovers Josh will be spending three months at a training camp in Spain - and starts making plans to join him abroad. Terese worries that Imogen has relapsed into her bingeing habits after some food goes missing, while Toadie is devastated to learn about Jacob kissing Sonya

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: NewsTalk Live
programme.desc: Topical debate and in-depth analysis of the day's major stories, with experts discussing the key talking points of the issues making the headlines and viewers also having the chance to give their opinions. Presented by Emma Crosby

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: A look at the origins of the sci-fi show created by Gene Roddenberry in the 1960s, which spawned four TV spin-offs and a movie franchise. Featuring interviews with the producer of the original series Herb Solow, Roddenberry's son Rod, star Leonard Nimoy (Mr Spock) and fan club members Bjo and John Trimble, the film charts Roddenberry's rise to fame and how he went to extraordinary lengths to keep his creation on air

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: In Manitoba, Hugh Rowland and Rick Yemm negotiate slushy roads, a thawing river crossing and a low bridge in their search for the abandoned trailers. Alex Debogorski is delivering goods to the tiny hamlet of Tuktoyaktuk in the Northwest Territories, but to get there he has to make a risky journey across the frozen Arctic Ocean

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben journeys to the foothills of the Indian Himalayas to spend time with 69-year-old former fighter pilot Steve Lall, who has opted for a simple farmer's life in the mountains. Ben gets hands-on with the harsh subsistence lifestyle, ploughing with buffalo, chasing both monkeys and human intruders, and gravedigging

programme.title: World's Scariest Animal Attacks
programme.desc: Terrifying encounters caught on camera by ordinary people. A diver narrates his own shocking footage of a great white shark breaking open his cage with its jaws. A giant anaconda sinks its teeth into a Brazilian policeman, an agitated elephant charges a honeymooning British couple on an African safari and a lion turns on its handler at an awards ceremony. Plus, chimpanzees on the loose in Northern Ireland and a frightening incident at a bullring

programme.title: Criminals
programme.desc: Retail crime in Britain is booming, with shops and businesses under attack from criminals who use everything from crafty tricks to brute force and violence to relieve stores of their goods. Journalist Nick Wallis goes out with police forces in Chester, Coventry, Rotherham and London to reveal how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring these criminals to justice

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: The return of the documentary following patients undergoing surgery at Liverpool's Walton Centre, which is the only specialist neuroscience NHS Trust. Father-of-three Dene Galloway is rushed to hospital following a sudden headache and neurosurgeon Michael Jenkinson has to operate when the growth in his brain bleeds. Neurologist Nicholas Silver treats 52-year-old Helga Kristensen, who has developed a cluster headache that is causing her excruciating pain, while Iona Davies' epilepsy is not responding well to drugs and her doctors think that surgery might offer a solution

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Compilation edition reliving house-transforming triumphs from the series. Property expert Ann Maurice visits Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire, to demonstrate design techniques for making small rooms appear bigger, while in Glasgow she reveals how to create a home that appeals to potential purchasers

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice and presenter Alistair Appleton offer advice to the owner of a loft apartment in Manchester. Although it is situated in a highly desirable area, the property is full of clutter and no one is prepared to offer the Â£115,000 asking price

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski visits Brighton and Kilburn Park, north London, to explore two striking missionary churches that reflect the High Church style of architecture

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Nick Baker profiles the great white shark, which can grow to 20ft in length. From the safety of an underwater cage, he has an encounter with one of the creatures off the Western Cape of South Africa. He also swims with fur seals and penguins

programme.title: LazyTown

programme.title: An American Tail (1986)
programme.desc: Young Russian mouse Fievel and his family board a ship bound for America during the 19th century to escape the barbaric rule of cats at home. On arriving in New York, Fievel and his parents become separated, and he has to fend for himself on the dangerous and unfamiliar streets of the city. Animated adventure, with the voices of Phillip Glasser, Christopher Plummer, Madeline Kahn and Dom DeLuise. Edited for flashing images

programme.title: Thunderpants (2002)
programme.desc: A 10-year-old boy blessed with an extra stomach and the ability to break wind extremely forcefully finds his talent gets him into all manner of trouble. His friend, who luckily lacks a sense of smell, invents a pair of special pants that help the flatulent youngster achieve his dream of becoming an astronaut. Family comedy, with Bruce Cook, Rupert Grint, Simon Callow, Stephen Fry and Celia Imrie

programme.title: Phenomenon (1996)
programme.desc: An unassuming car mechanic observes a peculiar bright light one evening on the way home from a bar, and finds himself transformed into a genius with telekinetic powers. However, he is unprepared for the problems that lie ahead, as he struggles to woo a divorced single mother while coping with his new-found gift. Fantasy drama, starring John Travolta, Kyra Sedgwick, Forest Whitaker and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: A visitor dies in Dr Sloan's house, but the body disappears before the police arrive, raising fears that the medic imagined it all. Drama, starring Dick Van Dyke and Scott Baio

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The owner of a chain of health clubs kills a business partner who was about to expose his crooked dealings. Making the death look like an unfortunate weightlifting accident, he cunningly creates the perfect alibi using a tape recording of his victim's voice - but he reckons without the intervention of the shabby sleuth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Conrad and Philip Bruns

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to find out who was responsible for sabotaging a robotic vehicle that caused the death of a Navy lieutenant and almost killed Abby. Meanwhile, Ziva's suspicions are aroused by the discovery that Tony is repeatedly visiting the hospital. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Michael Weatherly, Cote de Pablo and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The discovery of a dead marine intelligence officer in a motel room sets the team off on a hunt for her killer. Although the town's authorities have allegedly already investigated the crime, Gibbs is determined to conduct his own thorough inquiries - which may lead him to a terrorist cell. Drama, starring Mark Harmon

Thriller, starring Sarah Jane Morris and Michael Riley

programme.desc: An eccentric scientist sets out to prove his debunked theories on inter-dimensional travel by building a machine to transport him to other universes. His experiment succeeds, and he and two friends are stranded in another world inhabited by dinosaurs and all manner of other strange creatures. Comedy adventure, starring Will Ferrell, Anna Friel and Danny McBride. Edited for language

programme.desc: An astronaut crash-lands on a strange planet and is captured and enslaved by the ruling race of highly intelligent apes. Luckily, he is helped by a sympathetic chimpanzee - but then discovers a shocking secret. Remake of the 1960s sci-fi adventure, directed by Tim Burton and starring Mark Wahlberg, Helena Bonham Carter and Tim Roth, and featuring a cameo appearance from the original film's star Charlton Heston. Edited for violence and language

Feeling they have been double-crossed, they abandon the operation - but are compelled to return and save a captured rebel. Action thriller, directed by and starring Sylvester Stallone. With Jason Statham and Jet Li

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket (1987)
programme.desc: Raw recruits undergo harsh training under a domineering Marine drill sergeant after being called up for service in the Vietnam War, but his brutal methods lead to the breakdown of one of his cadets. Eventually, some of the fully trained soldiers get their first taste of combat in 1968. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Matthew Modine, Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio and R Lee Ermey

programme.desc: Adventure game show in which 20 men and women travel to Argentina to compete in physically demanding challenges on a purpose-built obstacle course. With cash prizes at stake, the heat is on and Amanda Byram will be trackside to catch all the action. Presented by Richard Hammond

programme.title: Motorway Cops
programme.desc: Documentary series following traffic police as they try to enforce the law on some of Britain's busiest and most dangerous highways

programme.title: Tough Young Teachers
programme.desc: The trainees approach the end of their spring term, and the pace of working life shows no signs of slowing down. Science teacher Claudenia struggles to manage a group of Year 10 girls and must decide whether a confrontation is the best solution. Maths teacher Nick takes on an extra life-skills lesson, but realises he knows little about the subject and asks fellow trainee Meryl for help. Meanwhile, at the Lanfranc school in Croydon, a fight outside the school has serious consequences for one of Charles's pupils

programme.title: Ja'mie
programme.desc: New series. Comedy following Ja'mie King as she embarks upon her final three months at Hillford Girls Grammar. She has set her sights on winning both the prestigious medal for the Best Girl in Year 12, and the affections of Mitchell, a new student at nearby Kelton Boys Grammar. Starring Chris Lilley and Lester Ellis Jr

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bianca is less than happy when Terry, feeling guilty after his treatment of Nikki, lets her stay for dinner before she leaves for Acapulco - and his ex soon shows her true colours when she offers David a proposition that would change his world. Will he accept? A drunken Masood turns up at Carol's, upset to discover she has cancer and angry she didn't think he could look after her, while Linda is excited at the thought of Johnny and Whitney getting together - horrifying her son when he realises his mum has not come to terms with his sexuality

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian accidentally sells Stewie's favourite teddy bear at a garage sale, so dog and baby embark on an epic journey to reclaim it from the buyer. Meanwhile, Peter loses his licence owing to careless driving, forcing Meg to chauffeur him everywhere

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers his mother had an affair while on holiday in Ireland 40 years previously, and crosses the Atlantic to search for his real father. Meanwhile, Stewie develops a love of punishment

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Roger acts as the Smith family therapist under the guise of his alter ego Dr Penguin, but his services are cut short when he is sent to fight in the Iraq War - leaving Klaus with the opportunity to take over his counselling duties

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Steve tries to prove his toughness to Stan by adopting the persona of a superhero, while Francine also goes through an identity crisis when she receives news that could change the family for ever

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Having found himself a new companion in the shape of Clara Oswald, the Doctor asks where she wants to go first - and her request for somewhere awesome takes the pair to the rings of the planet Akhaten, inhabited by all manner of amazing creatures. Clara meets the young queen, who is about to take part in a ceremony called the Festival of Offerings - but what begins as a happy sing-song soon turns very grim. Matt Smith and Jenna-Louise Coleman star

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor and Clara land on a damaged Russian submarine in 1983 as it spirals out of control into the ocean depths. To make matters worse, an alien creature is loose on board, having escaped from a block of Arctic ice - and with tempers flaring and a cargo of nuclear weapons, it's not just the crew but the whole of humanity at stake. Matt Smith and Jenna-Louise Coleman star

programme.title: Snog, Marry, Avoid?
programme.desc: Comedienne Ellie Taylor presents the makeover show that aims to uncover the UK's natural beauties. In this edition she visits Birmingham to find out why some fashion-conscious Brits are enhancing their rear ends, where the Personal Overhaul Device assesses pink-haired, perma-tanned Danny GoGo and Sophie, who is obsessed with hair extensions

programme.title: Confessions of a Shopaholic (2009)
programme.desc: Aspiring fashion journalist Rebecca Bloomwood accepts a position writing for a financial magazine. As she sets the publishing world alight with her unique brand of consumer advice, Rebecca is forced to confront her own purchasing habits and begins to question whether rampant spending sprees are the way to true happiness. Comedy, starring Isla Fisher, Hugh Dancy, Krysten Ritter and Joan Cusack

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Carol worries about her first chemotherapy appointment but insists on going alone, while Kat is buzzing with excitement about Alfie's return and heads off to meet him at a hotel - only to be left shell-shocked by an unexpected encounter along the way. Shabnam tries to help Masood get his life back on track, although when Tamwar sees him heading to the Vic it seems their father isn't so interested in helping himself, and he issues him with an ultimatum

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian constructs a play that becomes a hit in Quahog, but loses his confidence when he finds that Stewie is also a budding playwright and is better at it. When the toddler sees how upset his friend is, he decides to make amends. Animation, featuring the guest voice of playwright Alan Bennett as himself

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire accidentally marries a prostitute when he, Peter and Joe get drunk while visiting the Harvard University campus. Desperate to escape his new wife, he decides to pretend he is gay, and turns to one of his companions to become his emergency boyfriend

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Comedy show, hosted by Russell Kane, featuring a blend of stand-up routines. The youth club stages a sex education class, French bon viveur Marcel Lucont recounts some of his earliest memories and East End Cabaret provide an eye-watering tale of how to deal with a stiff situation

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine ignores her husband's objections and buys Steve the dog he has always wanted. However, when a horrific accident leaves the canine in critical condition, a traumatic memory from his childhood leaves Stan unable to turn off life support

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan finally saves enough money to join the golf club he has worked at for the past 30 summers - only to discover Steve has been given a membership before him. However, everything changes when the CIA officer learns who owns the business

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: Over a family lunch hosted by Errol's grandmother Joan (Hadyn Gwynne), Andy desperately tries to retain his bond with his nephew when Errol's other `cool' uncle, Rex, returns home from holiday. Meanwhile, Sam and Ben hit a snag in their custody battle, Errol learns he has a secret admirer, and Andy cannot help feeling tense around Joan. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott

They both want to prove how independent they are to their parents, and do not realise that they are actually on the island too, witnessing their children fire skipping, getting drunk and having one-night stands

programme.title: Great Movie Mistakes 2
programme.desc: Comedian Robert Webb uncovers hundreds of gaffes in Hollywood's biggest blockbusters. The programme features continuity errors, historical inaccuracies, crew appearing on camera and booms dropping into shot in films including Avatar, Shutter Island, The Karate Kid, Transformers, Kick-Ass, Robin Hood and Star Trek

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The motoring show returns for another batch of road tests, challenges and hot laps by celebrity guests. Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Enemy of the State (1998)
programme.desc: A chance encounter with an old friend derails a successful lawyer's fast-track career, plunging him headlong into a deadly game of cat and mouse with relentless government agents capable of anticipating his every move. He quickly realises the only way to save his own life is to expose the truths his pursuers seem so intent on covering up, and seeks out a former intelligence agent to take them on at their own game. Thriller, starring Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight and Lisa Bonet

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg tries to build up her savings by starting work at a huge new superstore, but it proves so popular that all the other local shops go out of business, prompting Brian and Stewie to lead a protest against the retail giant

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Lois try to steer Chris away from joining the army by getting him interested in other activities - but Stewie remains determined to enlist, eager to get his hands on some heavy-duty firepower. With the guest voice of Louis Gossett Jr

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter's performance at work suffers after he injures his hand in a fireworks accident, so Lois volunteers to help him out. Meanwhile, Brian tells Stewie he is dating someone, but the baby ridicules him when he discovers it is an attractive but unintelligent woman. Featuring the voice of Drew Barrymore

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois becomes the sex education teacher at Chris's school, but faces the wrath of parents when they learn she is being honest about the subject. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to hunt down the tooth fairy

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie falls in love with an old friend, but is unhappy to discover she does not share his feelings. Meanwhile, Lois makes Peter watch `chick flicks', inspiring him to make a film of his own. With the voice of Drew Barrymore

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter volunteers to join the police force in response to a directive by the Mayor of Quahog. Meanwhile, Meg threatens to commit suicide unless she finds a date for the school prom, so Brian agrees to take her

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian accidentally sells Stewie's favourite teddy bear at a garage sale, so dog and baby embark on an epic journey to reclaim it from the buyer. Meanwhile, Peter loses his licence owing to careless driving, forcing Meg to chauffeur him everywhere

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers his mother had an affair while on holiday in Ireland 40 years previously, and crosses the Atlantic to search for his real father. Meanwhile, Stewie develops a love of punishment

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: Over a family lunch hosted by Errol's grandmother Joan (Hadyn Gwynne), Andy desperately tries to retain his bond with his nephew when Errol's other `cool' uncle, Rex, returns home from holiday. Meanwhile, Sam and Ben hit a snag in their custody battle, Errol learns he has a secret admirer, and Andy cannot help feeling tense around Joan. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Comedy show, hosted by Russell Kane, featuring a blend of stand-up routines. The youth club stages a sex education class, French bon viveur Marcel Lucont recounts some of his earliest memories and East End Cabaret provide an eye-watering tale of how to deal with a stiff situation

programme.title: Bluestone 42
programme.desc: Comedy drama about a British bomb disposal unit in Afghanistan, focusing on the camaraderie, bonds and banter the soldiers in unit Bluestone 42 share, despite the dangers they face in their work. The team faces a difficult roadside operation, while new padre Mary grabs the attention of expert Nick. Oliver Chris, Stephen Wight and Kelly Adams star

programme.title: Bluestone 42
programme.desc: Nick is desperate to find decent food to use in an attempt to seduce Mary. Meanwhile, Simon gets into trouble on roadside operations. Comedy drama about a British bomb disposal unit in Afghanistan, starring Oliver Chris, Stephen Wright and Kelly Adams

programme.title: Great Movie Mistakes
programme.desc: A selection of blunders evident in Hollywood films

programme.title: Pop's Greatest Dance Crazes
programme.desc: Robert Webb presents an abridged edition of the show looking at dance fads, exploring how the choreography for a selection of popular songs became worldwide phenomena

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Spinning-chair singing contest, in which Kylie Minogue, Tom Jones, Will.i.am and Ricky Wilson seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there's a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through `blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Emma Willis and Marvin Humes present

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: The comedian offers his perspective on the big stories dominating the media across TV, online and in print in an edition from 2011, as well as picking up on overlooked items that raise a smile

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: The comedian offers his perspective on the big stories dominating the media across TV, online and in print in an edition from 2011, as well as picking up on overlooked items that raise a smile

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg goes on a Valentine's Day date with a guy she met online. Lois and Peter spend the day lazing in bed, Brian is visited by all of his former girlfriends and Quagmire is transformed into a beautiful woman

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris gets teased at school for his budget-brand trainers, and asks for money to help bring his image up to scratch - but is turned down. He attempts to steal it from his parents, but is forced into a blackmail pact when Meg confronts him and threatens to report his thieving antics. Meanwhile, Stewie and Brian become obsessed with singer Anne Murray

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: Over a family lunch hosted by Errol's grandmother Joan (Hadyn Gwynne), Andy desperately tries to retain his bond with his nephew when Errol's other `cool' uncle, Rex, returns home from holiday. Meanwhile, Sam and Ben hit a snag in their custody battle, Errol learns he has a secret admirer, and Andy cannot help feeling tense around Joan. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan grows fed up with Hayley and Jeff's lazy behaviour, so he bets them he and Francine can live on the minimum wage for a month. Steve and Roger undertake a mission to test-drive their dream car

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan joins Roger and Steve's fictional detective agency, but proves to be surprisingly incompetent at his imaginary job. An infuriated Roger orders Steve to fire him - but the youngster cannot bring himself to do it. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jenson hosts the edition from February 8, 1979. Includes performances from Mick Jackson, The Jacksons, Dr Feelgood, The Shadows, Darts, Rod Stewart, Elvis Costello & The Attractions, Leif Garrett, Judas Priest and Blondie. Plus, dance sequences from Legs & Co

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin suspects Paul will try to sabotage his vicars and tarts party. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Peter Egan and Penelope Wilton. First broadcast February 26, 1984

programme.title: London on Film
programme.desc: Archive footage of the city's suburbs, chronicling a confusing world of tidy semis, old villages and sprawling estates, as well as the hidden lives of those who reside there. Last in the series

programme.title: Sex
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts investigates how science came to understand sex - a simple word for a very complex set of desires, including individual passions, wants and emotions. She looks at how the world of science has strived to solve people's sexual problems, and searched for ways of improving performance

programme.title: Krakatoa Revealed
programme.desc: Professor Nick Petford lifts the lid on the eruption of the tiny volcanic island in 1883, with the help of some of the world's leading vulcanologists. The blast caused a series of tsunamis which devastated the nearby Asian coastline, resulting in the deaths of 36,000 people and prompting the first modern scientific study of such an event

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: In a documentary filmed in 2012, scientists predict a fit of violent activity on the sun will propel billions of tons of superheated gas and pulses of energy toward Earth. In 1989 one of these solar storms, which have the ability to close down modern technology, cut off the power to the Canadian province of Quebec. This documentary catches up with weather forecasters as they try to predict meteorological patterns and discovers how organisations including the National Grid are preparing for the cosmic tempest

programme.title: Rococo
programme.desc: Presenter Waldemar Januszczak explores the way that the period's art moved from fun and escapism to more unusual and haunting works, and looks at the dark satire of Hogarth, the mysterious figures of Longhi, the anguish of Messerschmidt and Goya's more macabre works. Last in the series

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jenson hosts the edition from February 8, 1979. Includes performances from Mick Jackson, The Jacksons, Dr Feelgood, The Shadows, Darts, Rod Stewart, Elvis Costello & The Attractions, Leif Garrett, Judas Priest and Blondie. Plus, dance sequences from Legs & Co

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin suspects Paul will try to sabotage his vicars and tarts party. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Peter Egan and Penelope Wilton. First broadcast February 26, 1984

programme.title: London on Film
programme.desc: Archive footage of the city's suburbs, chronicling a confusing world of tidy semis, old villages and sprawling estates, as well as the hidden lives of those who reside there. Last in the series

programme.title: Sex
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts investigates how science came to understand sex - a simple word for a very complex set of desires, including individual passions, wants and emotions. She looks at how the world of science has strived to solve people's sexual problems, and searched for ways of improving performance

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Transatlantic Sessions
programme.desc: Aly Bain and Jerry Douglas return with the music series featuring performances by acts from both sides of the Atlantic. The first edition includes contributions by Karen Matheson, Cara Dillon, Andy Irvine, Teddy Thompson, Aoife O'Donovan and Ewan McLennan at the show's new studios overlooking Loch Lomond

programme.title: Sound of Cinema
programme.desc: Neil Brand celebrates the art of the film soundtrack by exploring the work of movie composers and demonstrating their techniques. He begins by looking at how the classical orchestral score emerged, and investigates how its popularity remains strong today. He sheds light on the 1930s European composers such as Max Steiner and Erich Wolfgang Korngold who brought their Viennese training to Hollywood for movies including King Kong and The Adventures of Robin Hood, and how it took an American talent to produce a darker, more modern sound. He also meets film-maker Martin Scorsese and composer Hans Zimmer to discuss their work

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A classic documentary from 1984 in which Arena took the American musicians Don and Phil Everly back to the coal-mining area of Kentucky where their father Ike had also formed an act and played the guitar alongside his brothers in the 1930s. In the moody atmosphere of Muhlenberg County, the stars have an emotional reunion with three generations of Everlys. With contributions by master musician and producer Chet Atkins, songwriters Felice and Boudleaux Bryant, and the legendary guitar singer Mose Rager. Broadcast in tribute to Phil, who died just short of his 75th birthday in January

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The duo perform in a reunion concert in the autumn of 1983, staged at the Royal Albert Hall in London, which they chose because they had treasured memories of playing there with their father, Ike, a guitar virtuoso in his own right. The brothers' reconnection and subsequent live performance after 10 bitter years apart was such a high-profile event that the filming was fed live into the BBC Nine o'clock News. Arena's cameras proved that they and their unique sound could still capture the public's imagination

programme.title: Country at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of BBC session performances by country artists from the past four decades, including Tammy Wynette, Emmylou Harris, Johnny Cash, Dolly Parton, Charley Pride, Kris Kristofferson and Glen Campbell

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll Britannia
programme.desc: A look back at the beginnings of British rock 'n' roll, when acts such as the Shadows and Johnny Kidd and the Pirates helped to lay the foundations of an enduring musical culture. Including the current line-up of the Quarrymen - forerunners of the Beatles - performing Rock Island Line, and contributions by Cliff Richard, Marty Wilde, Joe Brown and Bruce Welch

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A classic documentary from 1984 in which Arena took the American musicians Don and Phil Everly back to the coal-mining area of Kentucky where their father Ike had also formed an act and played the guitar alongside his brothers in the 1930s. In the moody atmosphere of Muhlenberg County, the stars have an emotional reunion with three generations of Everlys. With contributions by master musician and producer Chet Atkins, songwriters Felice and Boudleaux Bryant, and the legendary guitar singer Mose Rager. Broadcast in tribute to Phil, who died just short of his 75th birthday in January

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley's three-part documentary exploring the history of medicine concludes as he tells the story of how scientists went from finding antidotes to poisons to applying otherwise dangerous toxins as a cure. He reveals why he believes, of all the natural remedies featured in his scientific tour, the tales of treatments derived from deadly substances are perhaps the most extraordinary he encountered. Last in the series

programme.title: Salamander
programme.desc: New series. Belgian thriller following Paul Gerardi, a police inspector whose investigation into the theft of 66 safe-deposit boxes from a private bank in Brussels unearths a complex conspiracy. The owners of the targeted boxes are all prominent figures from the top layer of society, and Gerardi finds himself trying to learn the truth about a sinister organisation called Salamander. Starring Filip Peeters, Mike Verdrengh and Koen de Bouw. In Flemish and French

programme.title: Salamander
programme.desc: On witnessing the assassination of Urbain and hearing about the death of his informant Strubbe, Gerardi now knows his suspicions of a major unreported bank robbery are correct. However, he is perturbed to realise his house is under surveillance and that his official inquiries are being thwarted. Belgian thriller, starring Filip Peeters and Koen De Bouw. In Flemish and French

programme.title: Pink Floyd
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the creation of the rock band's ninth studio album Wish You Were Here, which was released in 1975 and topped the charts in the UK and America. The record reflects on the legacy of Syd Barrett, who left Pink Floyd in 1968 and is eulogised in the song Shine on You Crazy Diamond. Featuring contributions by members Roger Waters, David Gilmour and Nick Mason

programme.title: Pink Floyd
programme.desc: A spectacular concert film from the musicians' A Momentary Lapse of Reason tour, filmed at New York's Nassau Coliseum in August 1988 using 27 cameras. The performance sees David Gilmour, Rick Wright and Nick Mason deliver several seminal tracks, including Shine On You Crazy Diamond, Time, Comfortably Numb and Wish You Were Here

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jenson hosts the edition from February 8, 1979. Includes performances from Mick Jackson, The Jacksons, Dr Feelgood, The Shadows, Darts, Rod Stewart, Elvis Costello & The Attractions, Leif Garrett, Judas Priest and Blondie. Plus, dance sequences from Legs & Co

programme.title: Wild China

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Author and architect Francesco da Mosto explores the countryside of Tuscany, Umbria and the Marche. He prepares pasta and picks grapes, before joining actress Maggie Smith to view Florence's art treasures. He also relates the story of St Francis of Assisi and visits a garden once owned by a British woman who fell in love with an Italian aristocrat

programme.title: Wainwright
programme.desc: Part-dramatised profile of writer and artist Alfred Wainwright, the enthusiastic fell-walker from Blackburn who became renowned for his pictorial guides to the English Lake District. More than two million copies have been sold since he began writing them in 1955, and they have become the standard reference work for the area

programme.title: Space Shuttle
programme.desc: Kevin Fong follows the scientists, engineers and astronauts of Nasa as they prepare for the 135th and final space shuttle mission. He meets the crew of the Atlantis shuttle, as well as the members of staff responsible for ensuring the craft is fully prepared for take-off, and goes behind the scenes at Florida's Kennedy Space Centre

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Maggie Aderin-Pocock joins Chris Lintott and the team as they focus on Jupiter - the largest planet in the solar system. Together they explore what causes the planet's extraordinary weather, and how its coloured bands and iconic `eye' are visible manifestations of a violent atmosphere. Guest reporter and physicist Dr Helen Czerski also explains why the planet looks the way it does

programme.title: Tomboy (2011)
programme.desc: Premiere. A 10-year-old girl moves to a new neighbourhood and is mistaken for a boy by the local kids. She decides to let them keep thinking she is male and leads a double life over the course of the summer holidays, becoming part of a gang of neighbourhood boys while her family remain oblivious. Drama, starring Zoe Heran and Malonn Levana. In French

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A classic documentary from 1984 in which Arena took the American musicians Don and Phil Everly back to the coal-mining area of Kentucky where their father Ike had also formed an act and played the guitar alongside his brothers in the 1930s. In the moody atmosphere of Muhlenberg County, the stars have an emotional reunion with three generations of Everlys. With contributions by master musician and producer Chet Atkins, songwriters Felice and Boudleaux Bryant, and the legendary guitar singer Mose Rager. Broadcast in tribute to Phil, who died just short of his 75th birthday in January

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Simon takes his new girlfriend on a double date, but his principles are tested when she says she will kiss him only if he lets her redesign his wardrobe. Elsewhere, Will considers the idea of spending time with a girl he finds embarrassing and boring. Comedy, starring Joe Thomas, Simon Bird and Hannah Tointon

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: For the first time in his career, Jake has a growing number of cases he just can't seem to solve, and the other detectives worry his run of bad luck will rub off on them. Holt asks Amy to take charge of a community outreach programme for at-risk youths, and Boyle helps Jeffords with a tough personal assignment. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Max meets Deke (Eric Andre), a like-minded student when she starts pastry school. Meanwhile, Caroline's first day working in the office is not quite what she was expecting, and manipulates the situation so she ends up sitting at a desk where Nicolas, the attractive owner, can flirt with her. Comedy, starring Kat Dennings and Beth Behrs

programme.title: Derren Brown
programme.desc: In this one-off special, the master illusionist and showman tries to pull off the perfect crime. He has bet renowned art collector Ivan Massow he can steal a painting from right under his nose. Derren reveals which work is being targeted - a piece by Turner-nominated British brothers Jake and Dinos Chapman - and tells Ivan exactly what time the theft will happen. He even provides a photograph of the person who is going to take it. In a bid to pull off the heist, he recruits a crew - not of career criminals or cat burglars - but of pensioners

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Cleveland Jr is forbidden to wear his giant pancake outfit on Halloween because his father deems it too childish, so tries to reinvent himself as a cool teenager

programme.title: The Ricky Gervais Show
programme.desc: Karl Pilkington ponders the experience of having kidney stones, and reflects on a variety of other phenomena. With Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant

programme.title: Glee
programme.desc: Will and Coach Beiste order the school's football players to join the glee club for a week in a bid to ease team tensions over Finn and his fellow singers. Meanwhile, Sue puts the Cheerios in a tricky position - forcing them to choose between singing and cheerleading - and the students tackle a classic Michael Jackson track

programme.title: Ugly Betty
programme.desc: Amanda tricks Daniel and Wilhelmina into attending a counselling session with Dr Sparks, Betty's apartment building gets burgled, and Marc loses something valuable. Comedy, starring America Ferrera and Becki Newton

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, plus interviews with the people who created them. Featuring a musical nun, a `cat woman' crashing her bicycle and a car that catches a golf ball. Last in the series

Annie and Ty spend a lot of time together in the run-up to the opening night of Spring Awakening, and when Harry catches them kissing backstage he becomes concerned about how fast their relationship is progressing. Silver finds stage-managing the play overwhelming, so Dixon offers to help. Shenae Grimes and Adam Gregory star

programme.title: Ugly Betty
programme.desc: Wilhelmina is livid when she encounters her drag queen impersonator, Wilhediva Hater. Meanwhile, Marc does a photoshoot with a famous director, and Betty wins an award for her blog, but faces a rough patch in her relationship with Daniel. Comedy, guest starring Vanessa Williams' brother Chris Williams

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: A mysterious woman tries to steal Chris's powers and return him to the future. Unable to stop her, the sisters devise a spell which will hopefully enable him to escape back to the present. Meanwhile, Paige decides to move in with Richard. Supernatural drama, starring Drew Fuller

programme.title: Glee
programme.desc: Finn is filled with confidence after winning the district championship, and sets up a charity kissing booth on Valentine's Day in the hope of enticing an old flame. Meanwhile, Kurt wrongly believes Blaine has feelings for him, and Will asks the glee club members to pair up and sing famous love songs

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess returns to the flat after spending an idyllic week with Russell (guest star Dermot Mulroney) at his house. However, her happiness with the new relationship is cut short when Cece points out that she is doing everything on her boyfriend's terms. Meanwhile, Winston starts working at a sports radio station, but quickly discovers that his new boss is bad-tempered and demanding

programme.title: The Mindy Project
programme.desc: A successful gynaecologist is unlucky in love and vows to improve her personal life by finding a man that matches up to her ideals. In the first episode, she decides to mend her ways when she makes a drunken toast at her ex-boyfriend's wedding. Comedy, starring Mindy Kaling

programme.desc: Jeff forgets to book a table at an upmarket restaurant for himself and Audrey, so claims the last-minute reservation is needed for a celebrity. Meanwhile, Liz confesses to Russell that she was unfaithful during their marriage, and takes him along to her Sex Addicts Anonymous meeting

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony is backed into a corner as his secrets are exposed, but it remains to be seen how Diane will react to discovering the extent of his illicit dealings. John Paul's feeble attempt to regain some ground in his power struggle with Finn backfires dramatically at a parents' evening, and Jason plans a romantic treat for Holly in the deserted deli - unaware he is placing both their lives in grave danger

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall feels guilty about firing his incompetent assistant. Meanwhile, Zoey enrols in Ted's class and manipulates his students into taking her side in the fight to save the Arcadian building from being torn down. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor, Jason Segel and Jennifer Morrison

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted runs into Zoey at a black-tie fundraiser for the Natural History Museum and sees a different side to her when he meets her husband, the Captain. Later, Marshall argues with Lily over his career path, and Barney makes a shocking discovery. Comedy, guest starring Kyle MacLachlan (Desperate Housewives)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj feels upset about not being in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find a date and introduces him to a girl he can actually talk to. They hit it off, but when it becomes apparent he has been buying her expensive gifts, his friends suspect she is only interested in his wealth

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's old adversary Wil Wheaton returns and invites everyone to a housewarming party. Leonard is eager to go, but Sheldon threatens to shun him if he attends. However, he soon changes his mind when he finds out that Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Brent Spiner will also be there

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's mother comes to visit and woos the gang, but he cannot help feeling jealous of all the attention she is receiving - until a bout of illness lays him low, and he suddenly sees the benefits of having her around. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard has doubts about his feelings for Priya when he kisses a girl he meets in the comic-book store, while the rest of the gang play pranks on Sheldon in celebration of Halloween. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The grand opening of The Hutch arrives, and as local journalists gather at the restaurant, Ste's association with one of the village's most ruthless residents threatens to derail the whole event. Cindy becomes convinced that someone else knows about her involvement in Browning's death, and Ruby fears Ziggy may be tempted to play away again when he announces his intention to hire a new PA

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: With their wedding looming, Robin and Barney try to relax at a restaurant, but plot revenge on a couple who ruin their evening. Ted invites Lily to see the house he has been renovating in the suburbs and shares his plans of moving to Chicago after the ceremony. Meanwhile, Marshall takes Marvin on a last-minute trip to Minnesota to see his family before leaving for Rome

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: New series. The American sitcom returns as the gang travel to Long Island to attend Robin and Barney's wedding, but the couple make a startling discovery about their families en route. Meanwhile on his way back from Minnesota, Marshall realises his mother has posted a picture online declaring he has accepted his dream job before consulting his wife, and Lily realises that Ted hasn't dealt with his feelings for Robin. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A kidnapper demands a ransom from a supermarket magnate in return for sparing the life of a boy who has been reported missing. Frost manages to identify a likely suspect - but with no clues to go on, it looks as if throwing away the rule book may be the only way to save the child. David Jason and Bruce Alexander star

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl is snatched from a troubled housing estate, presenting a fresh challenge for clinical psychologist Dr Tony Hill, who sets about trying to build up a profile of her abductor before time runs out. Unfortunately the case turns into a murder inquiry with the discovery of her body, and the team is left racing to save another innocent life. Robson Green and Simone Lahbib star

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Adam is assigned to help investigate a Soho amusement arcade manager suspected of running a rent-boy operation, but gets in way over his head when he is mistaken for a shy punter. Joe also experiences problems with the case as one of the boys involved leads him on a wild goose chase - just as he thinks he is about catch the suspected pimp. Crime drama, starring Mel Raido and David Harewood

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part one of two. Meanwhile, Sergeant Craddock finds his efforts to prepare for an important visit hampered by a series of attacks on the station, and Vernon makes a startling discovery in his bathtub. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: After finding out about the hospital's staffing problems, Jill offers to cut short her maternity leave and return to work, while Matron notices that Catherine is doing her best to avoid Adam. Out in Africa, Jeff faces the horrors of war and makes a promise to a dying woman - but faces difficulties in keeping his word

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An FBI agent crosses swords with Poirot while trying to retrieve the American Navy's top-secret plans for a new submarine, which have been stolen by a glamorous nightclub singer with a sideline in espionage. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester joins a sponsored cycle race to Brighton in aid of the RSPCA, but risks finishing up in worse shape than most of the animals she is trying to help. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: In an attempt to gain some time together David and Linda enlist gormless, accident-prone Neville as a go-between, knowing that neither Amy or Robert can stand him. However, he proves to be particularly inept at the task and innocently leads Amy to the would-be lovers' rendezvous

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mrs Roper wants to install a shower, but a lack of cash forces a compromise on costs - and workmanship. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part one of two. Meanwhile, Sergeant Craddock finds his efforts to prepare for an important visit hampered by a series of attacks on the station, and Vernon makes a startling discovery in his bathtub. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica helps Sheriff Amos Tupper investigate the murder of his deputy's wife and discovers a few surprising facts about the bereaved husband along the way. Drama, starring Angela Lansbury and Tom Bosley

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A starlet engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William decides to take Mary's advice and lose a few pounds, while the object of his affections is relieved to be given another chance at work, on the condition that she make herself available for night calls. It's a busy time at the funeral parlour, as three teenagers are killed in a car accident, and Molly seizes the opportunity to move closer to her daughter. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel has a lucky escape while walking home when she narrowly avoids being hit by a car. Shaken, she starts pursuing the driver, who has fled on foot, and the next day she suspects the incident was an attempted murder - and that Nick may be involved. As she tries to deal with the revelation, Janet is left to take charge of the latest case - the gang shooting of a teenager whose friend is a key witness. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Vickers goes undercover in a pole-dancing club thought to be the front for a prostitution racket, but he has to call on all his guile and cunning to get himself off the hook after Joe begins to realise his boss is in collusion with the chief suspect. Gritty drama, starring Tim Pigott-Smith, David Harewood and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Steptoe and Son (1972)
programme.desc: Rag-and-bone man Harold breaks away from his father for long enough to marry a glamorous stripper - but makes the short-sighted decision of letting his dishevelled dad tag along on their honeymoon. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Harry H Corbett, Wilfrid Brambell, Carolyn Seymour and Victor Maddern. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Soap/Melodrama/Folkloric

programme.title: Movies Now
programme.desc: News, reviews and interviews with the stars

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The great detective reveals to a startled Watson how he defeated Moriarty and cheated death beneath the waters of the Reichenbach Falls. Period drama, marking Edward Hardwicke's debut as Holmes' indefatigable chronicler

programme.title: Life with Judy Garland
programme.desc: Part two of two. Judy Davis stars in the conclusion of the two-part drama charting the turbulent personal life of the legendary star, focusing on how years of dependence on prescription drugs and alcohol eventually took their toll. Hugh Laurie, Victor Garber, Tammy Blanchard and Alison Pill star. Based on the memoirs of Judy's daughter, Lorna Luft

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan as the genteel sleuth. A woman experiences an unsettling vision after moving into the home of her dreams - and it transpires she lived in the house as a child. Miss Marple investigates the history of the property and discovers it was connected with a baffling disappearance years before - which has never been solved. With Dawn French, Russ Abbot, Geraldine Chaplin, Phil Davis and Sarah Parish

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The inspector and his sidekick DS Hathaway investigate the murder of a talented maths student. The prime suspect is the victim's ex-boyfriend, who is convinced his uncle has set him up, but old case papers belonging to Morse reveal the boy's family is hiding a dark secret. Laurence Fox and Rebecca Front co-star alongside Kevin Whately

programme.title: The Young Ones (1961)
programme.desc: A clean-cut teenager tries to save his youth club from a greedy tycoon who wants to demolish it and build an office block by recording a hit pop single. Musical, starring Cliff Richard, Robert Morley, Melvyn Hayes, Richard O'Sullivan and Carole Gray and the rest of the Shadows. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A starlet engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The mysterious death of a former police commissioner forces a reluctant Morse to team up with old professional rival Chief Inspector Dawson. As they and Sergeant Lewis begin to investigate, a link is uncovered to the unsolved case of a girl murdered 18 years previously. John Thaw stars, with Kevin Whately, Kenneth Colley and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to cure a patchy lawn at a select language school hiding dark secrets. The disappearance of a Polish student alerts them to a tale of passion, rivalry and revenge, and when a handyman is found with his throat cut they race to find the killer. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa faces off with love rival Carrie in a battle for Martin's affections, and romance is in the air for Aunt Joan, who gains an admirer in the form of Edward. Elsewhere, Al makes a surprise reappearance and PC Penhale celebrates his birthday. Martin Clunes stars, with Joe Absolom and Louise Delamere

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of social worker Jenny Lister, but figuring out the motive behind the killing of an apparently popular woman proves difficult. However, an infamous past case involving the death of a child appears to hold the key. In her pursuit of the truth, Vera uncovers the failings of an understaffed care system and discovers the secret at the heart of Jenny's death - which the killer will stop at nothing to protect. Drama based on the book by Ann Cleeves, starring Brenda Blethyn and David Leon

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: First of a two-part episode of the popular crime drama, in which the disappearance of an ambitious surgeon keeps Frost and new partner DS Reid busy, especially when it transpires quite a few people have cause to want her out of the way. On the personal front, a mysterious woman arrives on Frost's doorstep with some startling news regarding his past. Starring David Jason, Bruce Alexander, Robert Glenister and Arkie Whiteley

programme.title: Housesitter (1991)
programme.desc: An architect has a fling with a kooky waitress, who takes it upon herself to move into his house and pass herself off as his wife. When the woman he is actually in love with says she thinks the marriage is good for him, he decides to play along with the deception. Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris. Including FYI Daily

programme.desc: Text-based information service
